text: The whole team at Oak View is amazing!

resp.text: Elizabeth - We appreciate you recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners!  Thanks!

name: Sandra Boone
text: We’re new to the area, our dog was bitten by something & needed to be seen ASAP, brought him right on down, filled out the paperwork & within 10min they were out to get him. Very friendly & professional staff! Not to mention the prices were very reasonable! Would definitely recommend them to anyone in need! God Bless the Vet & all the staff that helped with our sweet baby. Praying I never need them again but if I do I know he will be safe with them!

name: Mikayla Tate
text: They do not care about the health of animals here. They are money hungry and just plain out rude people. I wouldn’t waste any money/ or time at this place. I can guarantee they won’t help you properly.

name: Wendie Warren
text: I paid $280 after sitting in parking lot for over two hours ( 2a.m.-4:30 a.m.) with my dog without him being treated. My dog was in extreme pain the whole time. I left some time after 6 a.m. My dog is still sick and in pain and I have no answers still. I have no extra funds to have him seen again. I shouldnt have had to pay this much for nothing. I could take him to his Veterinarian if I had not wasted it there.

name: Jeremy (Jackal City)
text: They took us seriously wether or not the situation was serious for our kitten and communicated with us openly about our kitten at a time of what we thought was an emergency. She happily dealt with my "google doctoring" questions and happily communicated specific advice and concerns for our kittens health. I feel better knowing they are available for emergencies.

name: Valerie Morente
text: Our little rat terrier was attacked by a large dog. He did a lot of damage. I called every vet in Panama City and nobody answered as it was the weekend. As a last ditch effort I tried Dothan and SRVS was first to come up. They were so friendly, kind and helpful.  They kept coming to the car to update us on her condition. Their price was a fraction of what it would have been anywhere in Panama City. I've never had such a good experience, considering the circumstances. Our little dog is doing better. Thank you SRVS for helping our dog and treating us like we were more than just a number. Y'all are the best!

name: Lynn Hornsby
text: I’ve never done a review but I think SRVS deserves my first. Everyone I came in contact with was exceptionally nice and exhibited a caring attitude to my Roxy. I will say I was a bit nervous about leaving her with the staff I was unable to meet which I totally understand. After talking to Dr. Davis I felt totally comfortable leaving her. Dr. Davis himself called me multiple times during the 24 hours Roxy was there. Thanks Harriet for getting us appointment so quickly!

name: Benji Carnley
text: 3 /18/2021     4:00am my babygirl wants to go out to potty and I notice she is stumbling around and wobbly on her feet like she’s drunk, needless to say my heart sinks to the floor, she was fine a few hours ago and now she can barely stand. Rushed her to SRVES and doctor Drew Davis literally braves a tornado warning to come to the office and see my girl!  Tentative diagnosis “old dog Vestibular disease”. In most cases the dog recovers within 7-14 days, my mind is now more at ease though it pains me to see her in that condition and know that I just have to basically wait it out. Well 48 hours later she is still wobbly but 1000% better than when I took her to SRVES. A HUGE thank you to dr. Drew Davis and and the nurse who’s name I didn’t get for your wonderful bedside manner and putting my mind at ease. Can’t say enough good things about them, when my girl was about 4 years old she liked to chase cars and one day finally caught one resulting in a broken jaw. SRVES repaired her jaw. Every time I have needed them they have been there, that kind of peace of mind is priceless.

name: Brandon Lolley
text: I did not  have a lot of money at the time but they took care of my dog beyond what they had to and beyond what any other vet Iv ever been to has they did so much more than they had to and I am very thankful I definitely recommend this place they where very caring and kind . I know where to go if I ever need to make another vet visit.

name: Kittie Jones Cook
text: Had to set in car for 3 hours while other pets got seen before us that got there after our cat. They acted like our cat wasn't as important as the dogs that kept coming in after us.

name: Rhonda Smith
text: Took my cat in for difficult breathing problems. He had been mouth breathing for about 6 months and getting only temporary relief from steroid shots. It took Dr. Martin about 2 min to find the problem! Dr. Martin removed a large Polyp from my cats sinuses . It was blocking his airway.  Now, my fur baby can breath through his nose like a normal cat!  The staff was very friendly and professional. Everything was up front and no hidden charges! Thank u Dr. Martin and staff for helping my fur baby!

name: Hope Snapp
text: The service is great and they are very caring and professional.  However, the cost is outrageous for emergency service. The cost is more than double what a vet would charge, but they know they can extort this money from people because you are in an emergency situation where you either have to pay their fortune or let your pet die. I just paid 950.00 for my cat who had bladder stones because I had no other choice and they know this.  I am very grateful for the care he received and fortunately I was able to pay it, but many people in that situation would not be able to do this and would have to let their pet suffer.

name: Debbie Whittaker
text: My little dog Penny has had 2 successful knee surgeries ( one on each knee). Dr. Martin and his staff were very kind and compassionate with me and Penny and took time to explain what needed to be fixed and how it would be fixed. They were available 24 hours in case I needed to call with concerns. She is on her way to a full recovery and so thankful to SRVS for helping her live a pain free life.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind remarks.  We are so thankful that Penny had great results.  Please keep us up to date on how Penny is doing and if we can do anything else for you both.

name: Kenneth Owen
text: Regularly reported mistreating or offering EXTREMELY poor service for pets who are suffering, all while demanding more and more and more money, refusing to see the animals while they're dying until you make a payment, then refusing continued life saving treatment until payment. Unreal that they literally have YEARS of bad reviews and they're still in business.

name: V Gregor
text:
The staff and doctors are absolutely fantastic at this vet clinic.
We brought in our dog Phoenix for his second ACL surgery, the first one was performed in Panama City and the other side needed to be done, they did an absolutely fabulous job on Phoenix, he is turning 10 and he is completely back to normal. For complex surgeries I would always pick this vet clinic over anybody else. Thank you so much for taking his pain away and bringing him back joy to his life. Before the surgery we were able to see the pain in his face for months, we are so grateful.

resp.text: That is exactly why we are here!  We specialize in surgery and are thankful we were able to provide great care to Phoenix.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you and thank you for your comment.

name: Susan Wiest
text: At the very end of 3/20 our dog ruptured her CCL and tore her meniscal cartilage.  This was at the very beginning of COVID19; however they remained open with professional phone and curbside service.  We drove our dog, Daisy, from Lynn Haven, FL to Dothan for surgery.  They were professional and caring.  It's now seven months later and she has healed wonderfully!  She gets to run, play, and go hiking with us again.  Her surgery, TTA-2, was a wonderful blessing! Thank you so much!!!

name: John Downer
text: Eight weeks post surgery and our 90 lb blue healer (JD) is doing fantastic. Everything concerning his care was superb. Staff was the best ,very helpful & understanding. Dr. Martin's skills were an absolute blessing from heaven for our pet. We are most greatful

name: Kathleen Cassels
text: My 4 year old  Dachshund, Elsa, needed a disc surgery which required an over night stay. Dr. Martin and his staff were very knowledgeable in their diagnosis, as well as, very kind and compassionate to Elsa . I was informed within a short time after Elsa's surgery from Dr. Martin himself as to how everything went during the operation. In addition, I was impressed to find out that  on the day of Elsa's surgery ,and the following day, Dr. Martin took the time to call Elsa's hometown Veterinarian {Dr. France, Cairo, GA } to keep her informed of her progress. I 'd like to mention his technicians and his office staff members who were very professional. Thank you , again,  SRV Specialists!

name: maxnmimi
text: My GSD was in serious pain and it was determined she had severe case of hip dysplasia . I made contact with this Vet facility, after Auburn University Vet hospital recommended Dr. Martin for her hip replacement surgery. I made several calls over a month ago to get my GSD seen,  I never call a got back from them, each time i called, they said they would get back to me. After two weeks, my husband was able to get an appt the following next week. he drove two hours from columbus, ga to dothan al. They did an assessment and took some graphs of my GSD. and we paid close to 400 dollars and then said they could contact my husband to schedule hip surgery for my GSD. One week later we haven't heard from them, my husband called them again, only to have them say they cannot do it and recommended someone in Virginia, eight hours away.  Totally worthless and time wasted as my GSD is suffering. We found another vet facility that can do the surgery... Awful customer service, beware if you care about the medical treatment of your beloved pets!!

name: Tayvien White
text: The staff was really nice, however I don’t feel as if they really tried to treat my dog or figure out what was wrong with him. He’s not aggressive by any means, he was scared and not sure of his surroundings, with a muzzle on, on top of being surrounded by strangers so he wasn’t at ease. They took him to the back and I went with them to try and calm him down, he wouldn’t calm down because he wanted the muzzle off, in the mist of all this they were asking me how much I wanted to spend and to come to the front so they could charge me the $112 by the time they ran my card they came out and said they didn’t know what was wrong they gave him a shot to calm him down that’s $30 and to take him to Auburn they have the proper equipment to treat him, so I left and took him to Panama City (Animal Care) he walked to the car and petted him and walked him inside with out a muzzle on and talked to him the whole time and he was at ease. Come to find out he had chewed up my inhaler and it was causing his dilated eyes, pacing and his confusion.  The vet  was even dumbfounded to find out they were trying to send me to Auburn and didn’t understand why they didn’t all leave the room for me to remove the muzzle and calm him down, and how they didn’t even try! He even apologized for their actions and for me making a 1.30 drive for absolutely no reason he didn’t even charge me for my 11p visit & he kept apologizing on their behalf & made it clear if they’re afraid of a dog they are in the wrong professional field.

resp.text: Mr. White, to clarify events, your dog was very aggressive upon arrival and you were not even able to control his behavior.  You stated that you even had difficulty loading him in the car.  One of our techs was injured in the process of handling your dog and you were in the room when he was actively aggressive toward everyone.  We refunded your exam too since we were not able to put hands on your dog.  We did sedate your dog with no effect while here and referred to Auburn since Auburn has specialists and criticalists equipped to handle such situations.  By the time you arrived at Animal Care Center, the sedation was likely in full effect and possibly the effects of the inhaler (which was not disclosed to us) were dissipating.   I am not surprised at your testimony that your dog was behaving much better BUT he was heavily sedated at the time.  We cannot treat what we cannot evaluate which is why you were refunded the exam fee and referred to Auburn.  We are pleased to know that the sedation King received helped make it possible for another veterinarian to evaluate him.

name: Joshua Jones
text:
Unfortunately I've had the terrible experience of having to choose between euthanizing my dog and seeing her suffer.  This had nothing to do with how she had been cared for her whole life, seeing how she had lived well beyond her life expectancy and was a very happy and loving.  I knew her life was coming to a close but when I found her collapsed on the back porch one day after letting her out , she appeared to be suffering from a stroke or cerebral hemorrhage I took her to Southern Regional  Veterinary Specialist because it was the weekend and my usual Veterinarian was closed. The staff were very helpful and caring but unfortunately there was nothing that could be done except ending any pain or suffering that she may have been experiencing.  The experience was awful but the staff were very kind.

A few months after this I was looking after a friends place in a rural area when I kept hearing a persistent tiny meowing from a kitten.  Unfortunately his hind leg had been pinned and severely mangled and I was afraid I was going to have to once again have to poor animal euthanized but after once again having to take the animal to southern Regional because it was the only vet open they reassured me that they could save the animals life and that he would have a good chance of having a pretty normal and happy life albeit without one limb. I choose to adopt the poor critter and spend the money to have the amputation performed. I can say that although the price was what I would describe as fairly considerable, its been by far the best choice I've ever made. The cat and I have bonded like no other animal and I have before. I am very thankful that the staff explained that the kitten would very likely survive the amputation surgery and go on to have a normal and happy life as an indoor cat. I was worried about him not being able to get around well or being handicapped by the surgery but they assured me that since he was so young he would very likely adjust and go on to adapt to not having it and indeed this is what happened.  He is very happy, loving, playful and gets around just as well as any cat I've ever had. He's very fast and can jump on a counter top with very little difficulty and has had no problems to speak of  besides not being able to scratch behind his ear very well on the affected side,  which I happily scratch for him when I see the need or he brings it to my attention.   A can not give any kind of review about any of the other services that southern Regional may have or offer but when it comes to emergency pet care, they have by and far been the most reliable and accessible solution no matter the situation.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your story and experience with the emergency practice.  We are thankful we were here to help you and are still here if you need us in the future.

name: kimberly arnold
text: Wonderful, caring staff.  Quick service!!  My 18 month old pup got in a fight with a fishing rig and lost.  Hook set in his mouth.  Quick surgical procedure to cut out, remove and stitch up.  Very reasonable considering it was a Sunday night!  Would highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words regarding your experience.  We have seen a fair number of fish hooks and were thankful Buddy was not badly hurt.  Thank you for trusting us with his care and let us know if there is anything else we can do for you in the future.

name: L.R. Kirkland, Jr.
text: My family has needed SRVS Emergency Services on two occasions for the care of beloved pets.  The first time, our pet expired due to sudden cardiac death while in route to SRVS.  On arrival the staff acted swiftly to assess Bailey’s condition and determine further resuscitation was futile.   Dr. Sennett and the entire staff were compassionate and comforting  when we needed those exact expressions of care.  More recently, our eleven year old Siamese, Bonnie Blue, suddenly became seriously ill.  Dr. Tabitha Barber, who admitted Bonnie to their hospital and stabilized her condition, carefully reviewed the many possible diagnoses, X-Ray’s and lab findings with us, stayed near Bonnie’s side through the night, responded quickly when seizure activity began around 4:00 AM and called me with an update.  The next morning Dr Martin continued assessing Bonnie’s condition and agreed with Dr Barber that she appeared to have a central brain malfunction of some kind, due to a vascular event, a lymphoma or other unknown cause. Dr. Martin didn’t hesitate in recommending sending Bonnie to Auburn for further evaluation and treatment. Dr. Martin’s staff called the referral to Auburn and made for a smooth transfer.  We are so grateful that Dr Barber and Dr Martin encouraged us to seek further care at Auburn’s School of Veterinary Medicine.  Because of their solid recommendation to transfer the patient to Auburn, Bonnie has made a near 100% recovery at five weeks out.  Dothan is truly fortunate to have this 24-hour Emergency Medicine and Regional Surgical Referral Center for Animals.

name: Amanda Traum
text: Amazing customer service. Patient staff who took their time to explain my dogs situation to me and laid out in layman's terms, my options. DR. Martin is great at his surgical procedures which, when healing do not have much scarring.  He is also extremely knowledgeable and talented at his job.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience.  If there is anything else we can do for you, please let us know.

name: Jane Kemp
text:
We were very pleased with the surgery our dog (Max) received at their hospital.

Dr. Martin is a wonderful surgeon & a very kind man.  The staff was also great!

resp.text: I am so glad that Max is doing well.  We are so thankful that you trusted us with his care.

name: Doug Johnson
text: Such a nice and caring staff. I am very appreciative of the care Stormy received while he was here.

resp.text: We were glad that we were here for Stormy.  Thank you for your comment.

name: Kimberly Hall
text: This is an emergency hospital for pets. It's open on the weekends after hours. It's a very good place to go in an emergency.  My niece's dog got hit by a car and we had to find someone quick to see Sofie. The lady there was very helpful and caring. Eventhough we went up there twice. She helped explain what was going on with our beloved Sophie and helped my niece accept the fact she was gone. It was a very trying time and tragic for all, and they were very respectful. I thank them form the bottom of my heart for there patience and comfort.

name: Dr Bart Precourt
text: Our 1 year old English Bulldog had a spine surgery performed by Dr. Martin.  He was very professional and we had a successful surgery.  Our pup stayed two nights at the hospital and the staff loved on him like he was family.  The front desk ladies were amazing and very caring.

name: Rachel Carrico
text:
Over the weekend my cat suffered a seizure. I took him to a vet in Ozark where they ran some tests, were not able to find any definitive reasons why it happened, told me to let him rest and return if he did not improve. On Sunday morning I woke up and my cat was unresponsive. I was unable to get in contact with the emergency number I was given to this vet, and was forced to look for an emergency vet to take him to. I am so thankful my fiance was able to find SRVS emergency vet.

We arrived and they rushed to us to take a look to see what was going on. After only a few minutes they were able to tell me what I already suspected; that he would not recover and would need to be euthanized. At some point he had suffered a stroke and had symptoms that would not improve. It was with a heavy heart we said our goodbyes, but the staff explained everything and gave us all the time we needed to make sure we were ready.

The staff was very professional, and just today I received a sympathy card in the mail with my cat's paw prints in memory of him that brought me to tears. I plan to get it framed and put up in my house, and I am SO thankful to them for not only taking care of my fur baby, but taking the time to send something so meaningful to me to hold onto forever. THANK YOU!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post this review.  We are very sorry for your loss and were glad to be here for you when you needed help.  I will be sure to pass this along to our staff.

name: jennifer barfield
text: Very kind, compassionate care! I’m so thankful for the care and love we received.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us to provide that care and for your comments!

name: Jennifer Henderson
text:
Thank you for saving our Remington! The staff was wonderful and very caring and supportive. I never met the doctor but have heard great things. If I had any complaint it would be that they tell you that you have to pay $400 or what ever the cost they think it will be before they will treat your dog that is kinda concerning thinking a dog could be there and dying but they won't help till the money comes through. I had to call a relative to pay over the phone before they would help him.
But I guess that's the world we live in now. I am still very grateful for the service and the staff my Remi is still here thanks to SRVS.
THANK YOU THANK YOU!!

resp.text: Unfortunately you are correct, we have been taken advantage of and have established protocols that give the appearance of not caring or only caring about the money.  While we would love to do everything for free, there is no way we would be able to stay in business and then we wouldn’t be available at all.  Thank you for posting this review and for understanding our position.  It is difficult for some to understand.

name: Teeta Simmons
text: Dr. Robert Martin has amazing knowledge and surgical skills.  We are so lucky to have this facility here in Dothan. Dr. Martin performed thyroid surgery on our cat Harley and he is back to his old self, which is really amazing!

resp.text: We are so happy to hear Harley is doing so well.  Thank you for letting us know and please let us know if there is anything else we can do to help you in the future.

name: Jean Sasson
text: Southeast Alabama is extremely fortunate to have such a facility and one of the best veterinarians it has been my pleasure to know:  Dr. Robert Martin.  After some cruel person abandoned a sick cat and it made its way to my yard, I had to make my way to Dr. Martin.  The poor little darling Marilyn Monroe was born with a terrible disorder that had her overeating, followed by projective vomiting.  She is a midget of a kitty cat due to the lack of nourishment.  I was fearful that she could not be saved but after a simple description from me, Dr. Martin immediately knew the problem. After running the appropriate tests, sure enough, he was right -- yesterday Marilyn Monroe underwent the operation to solve her problem and save her life.  Tonight she is home and happy.  Without Dr. Martin's years of expertise, I am not sure Miss Marilyn could have been saved.  I am happy.  Marilyn Monroe is happy.  The world is good again.  Thanks, Dr. Martin.  Your impressive skills are certainly appreciated by this client and her sweet kitty kat.  To everyone out there, if you have an unusual health problem with a pet, Dr. Martin is certainly the man to see.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Sasson for sharing your account.  We are so happy that we were able to help Marilyn Monroe and are thankful for her positive result.  Please keep in touch and let us know if there is anything else we can do.

name: Terry Leach
text: The Staff and Doctor Martin were very friendly. I would highly recommend them to anyone 😊

name: Chris Speigner
text:
Took my mothers dog in for emergency care. 1 year later I have a collections notice in the mail.
Never received the bill, which was for my mother in the first place. I find it funny that they can send me to collections and not even attempt to communicate to me.
Scott the Office Admin was very rude on the phone, wouldn't even talk to me at all because "you can speak to my attorney, attorney will talk to you, I am not going to communicate with you"

I hope this place never gets business again. Plenty of other vets in the area.

name: Brittany Ball
text: Dr. Martin is amazing! There are no words to express the gratitude my family and I have towards him and his team. Rebecca and the whole entire staff has been amazing to my sweet Callie during this tough time for her. Thank you for everything! I would not have wanted Callie’s health to be in anyone else’s hands.

resp.text: We are so glad that Callie is making positive improvements.  Thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to leave a review.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to assist you in the future.

name: Bob Young
text: Wonderful place, we were referred there from Lynn Haven Florida because out local vets could not do the operation on our cat Jinxy. They simply saved his life and we couldn't be more thankful and appreciative.

resp.text: We are so glad that Jinxy is doing so well.  Please let us know if you have any questions or anything else we can help you with in the future.

name: Frank Scott
text:
Our dog Charlie had a possibility ruptured disc Late one night. We were referred to your service
By our Vet in Panama City. We called Southern Regional Veterinary Specialist at 0930 on Monday morning to asked for an appt., and they asked how soon we could get there. So so we drove straight there and they saw us in just 15 mins., the Receptionist Harriet, was the kindness and the most thoughtful young lady we ever met in a Dr.'s office. The entire Staff were truely professional and caring. Then we meet Dr. Martin and we see why, he provides his patients and their family with professional assessments.  And you could tell that he really cared for the animals under his care. Dr. Martin diagnosed Little Charlie problem accurately and then operated. Dr Martin also keep us informed ever step along the way. Charlie was doing so well we brought him home 22 hrs later.
My Wife and I would be remiss if we did not write this letter of recommendation.  Let me say we are sure
You will find Dr. Martin And his entire Staff as one of most Godly and Professional Vet offices you will
Ever have the pleasure too visit.
Dr. Martin and Staff, well done good and faithful Servants!
Semper Fi Frank. Scott

resp.text: How is Charlie doing?  Thank you for your comments.  We try to be able to see everyone as soon as possible and are so thankful to make room for you and Charlie.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Kim Lee
text: Dr Martin walks on water as far as we are concerned!!  Our Marty had back surgery several years ago after an Ozark "vet" told me to put him in a BOX!!  He walks and runs and is a very happy dog!❤️🐾

resp.text: Marty is so fortunate to have you and your husband as owners.  We are so pleased that he is doing well and that you gave him the opportunity to get better.  I know that you have enjoyed watching him get better after surgery.

name: Chuck Outlaw
text: We took our Yorkie after hours for what appeared to be a very bad allergic reaction. They did a fantastic job treating our dog, stayed with her overnight and we got her home the next afternoon and she has done great! Thank you SRVES!

resp.text: Thank you Chuck for the kind review.  We are thankful that we could help and happy to do it.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Ted Folsom
text: They charged me 900.00 for a procedure to remove something that  clogged my dogs breathing. Did not help one bit she actually got worse. Took her to another vet within one week because the dog was getting worse. The second vet informed me had a severe sinus infection, she was anemic and her liver enzymes were high. He also got her records from SRVS and nothing was removed blocking my dogs airways which is why my dog had the 900.00 dollar procedure. My dog was given antibiotics, iron, and pills.for her liver.fromthesecond vet. She is much better after three days on the medicine, I wasted nearly a thousand dollars at this place do not go to this place I still wonder what was done here for my dog. Wish I give  no stars.

resp.text: There appears to be some confusion about what our veterinarian did regarding your dogs care.  Based on the information given, it was suspected that your dog had eaten some of its bed and that it was causing the airway obstruction.  The veterinarian noted after the procedure, that the stuffing material may not have been the ultimate cause of the clinical signs and that a follow up with your veterinarian would be necessary if symptoms got worse.  We are thankful that you followed up with your veterinarian and that your dog is doing well.  We are happy to speak with you over the phone if you have more questions about your visit early this month.

name: Stephanie Turner
text: I am thoroughly recommending to everyone!

resp.text: We are so glad you had a great experience with us.  Please let us know if we can do anything else.

name: BELINDA HALLMAN
text:
I will forever be grateful for Dr. Martin and the entire staff at SRVS! Our 18 month old Chihuahua Pee Wee was outside on Mother's Day playing when he took off running through the woods chasing a squirrel. When Pee Wee came out of the woods he was limping and wouldn't put any weight on one of his back legs, so we took him to the vet. After having x rays done we were informed Pee Wee had indeed broken his leg and the best option with the best outcome was surgery. After having Dr. Martin at SRVS highly recommend to us the x-rays were sent over and we was told to be expecting a call from SRVS. It didn't take long before I was contacted by SRVS to set up an appointment for Pee Wee to come in and have surgery. The lady I spoke with on the phone was extremely nice and set up Pee Wee an appointment for the following day. The morning we arrived for surgery we was greeted by both ladies at the front desk and was checked in. We didn't have to wait no time before we was called to the back.
Dr. Martin discussed everything with us and we was given an estimate of what it would cost. When given the estimate it was detailed very well with the lowest and highest estimate. (Which I totally appreciated) When we checked out I was ASKED if I could pay the lowest estimate right then and told if it did go over that amount they would let me know the following day when I returned to take Pee Wee home. It was explained to me that if it ended up costing less than the lowest estimate that I paid the day of the surgery that they would refund me the difference. I appreciated the fact that I was given the lowest and the highest estimates that way I would know  about what the cost would be. A couple of hours later I received a call from Dr. Martin himself informing me off Pee Wee's condition and details of how the surgery went. I was told if I wanted he could come home the following day or he could stay an additional night if I felt more comfortable with him there. I chose to go ahead and bring him home the following morning because he was doing well and we missed him dearly. The day after surgery I returned to pick him up and Dr. Martin went over all the aftercare instructions with me and the medications given. Pee Wee is home resting now and is expected to make a full recovery! ♥ Thank you Dr. Martin and ALL the staff at SRVS for taking such wonderful care of Pee Wee,  you've been such a blessing to our family!!! May God continue to shower you with blessings, for you all are true blessings to us and our beloved pets! ♥ Thank you!

resp.text: This is a very personal account of your visit and it shows the process well.  I am thankful for your experience and that we were here to help you.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Lisa Colvin
text: I was not aware of these emergency services. I am so thankful that they offer these service. Our fur baby became lethargic after 10 p.m. We went to SRVS and they were wonderful. He had to stay over night .  Everyone from the front desk staff, to the vet assistants, to the dr and to everyone who answered during the night and early morning when I called to check on him, were sweet, and comforting. They seemed to truly care about our puppy.  Words can not express how comforting it is to know now that if anything else happens to our fur baby that we can go to this amazing place. I highly recommend SRVS to take care of your pet.

resp.text: We are trying to make ourselves more visible to people so that others may benefit also.  I’m so glad that we were here for you in your time of need.

name: Laura Fowler
text: We used the emergency services when my husband and I woke up on a Sunday morning to our Lab vomiting and then suddenly began having uncontrolled bouts of bloody diarrhea. Our vet's after-hours services transferred us to Southern Regional, where the tech who answered the phone told us of the prices and that he needed to be brought in. We had Dr. Sayre who was very friendly and diagnosed him immediately with Hemmoragic Colitis and began treatment. Our baby was well enough to come home the next day and is doing fine. We have never had a dog that required overnight care, and given his symptoms, we were terrified that we could lose him. I am very happy with the care that he received, and while the visit was pricey, it was very much worth the immediate treatment.

name: Holly Ingram Speigner
text:
Very rude staff. My husband took his mother's dog in after she was attacked. Unfortunately Trixie didn't make it. We never received a bill in the mail but over a year later received a collections notice. We called to try and get some information as to why we never received a bill before we were sent to collections or why he was on a bill of his mother's and were ignored. They were extremely uncooperative and refused to even give information about the bill or how to take care of it.
GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

name: Sara Krystyn
text: Our pup just had her second surgery at SRVS yesterday (1/2/2019). She has had TTA's on both knees. Dr. Martin and his office staff have been absolutely incredible. From the moment you check-in you can tell they really care about you and your furry friend. They call when they say they will and they give you updates frequently. You hope your dog never has to have surgery, but if he or she does then it is such a blessing to have Dr. Martin and his staff in this area. Thank you to SRVS for caring for Nova (and us) so well. We appreciate all that you do!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind remarks and we were so thankful that you trusted us to care for your pup.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Brittany Caver
text: Wonderful staff!! We are from out of town, visiting family for the holidays, and did not know what to do! The emergency vet took great care of our dog, who was diagnosed with pneumonia!

name: gmomey ninja cool The goat
text: I went to Southern Regional veterinary emergency services because my dog was foaming at the mouth and I didn't know what happened to her. Two other animals came in one came in after me that was poisoned and I understand the vet's office wanting to help take care of the dying animals but they completely disregarded my animal as well as keeping me in my 5 year old son waiting for over 1 hour do not go to this emergency care service they have horrible customer service and one of the vet her name is sue is totally rude

name: Tina Hart
text: They were fast, extremely nice, personal and there when you need them late at night. They could have charged me much more but they were kind enough not to. Definitely recommend if you're ever in an emergency situation.

name: johnathon cobb
text: We took our frenchie Ruby in for paralysis from hemivertebrae. They made us an appointment very quickly knowing how important it was. Sadly they were not able to help her due to it being a neurological issue. Dr. Martin was fantastic and his staff was great to deal with. They tried to help in any way they could. Very on the spot service. I will use them again and recommend them.

resp.text: It was a pleasure to serve your family and Ruby.  We are sorry that her symptoms could not be fixed with surgery.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you in the future.

name: Didi Oates
text: I will NEVER take another animal to this place again. My cat is now worse than when he went in with blockage in his bladder they charged me over $700 and still wanted more money.. well sorry to say but I can't afford to pay any more.. will be taking them to court!

resp.text: It is understandable that finances can be a limiting factor when dealing with a very sick animal.  This is why we presented you with an estimate and had you sign it.  We feel that knowing potential costs on the front end can help you make a better decision.  By signing the estimate, you authorized us to care for your cat and we stayed within the estimate provided.  You were informed of your cat's critical state and the need for surgical intervention.  You chose to discontinue treatment and you were angry with us for treating his fever.  Your cat was well cared for while here and surgery was the best option to improve his condition.  We are sorry that you elected not to pursue this option and continue treatment.

name: Anastasia Baker
text:
SRVS saved our Great Dane's life and we will forever be grateful!

On a Saturday night, Finnley started to panic and attempt to throw up. After 10-15 minutes, we knew something was terribly wrong. We were referred to SRVS from another emergency vet closer to home at Fort rucker via telephone because he strongly felt  she had  major surgical problem. He advised us that they were the only ones set up for surgery unless we drove her to Auburn, AL. Regardless of them being the closest, we wouldn't have chosen anyone else knowing the experience we've had.

The staff immediately took an x-ray and Dr. Champion confirmed our worst fear, she had a flipped stomach. Finnley would have been dead in a matter of hours had they not rushed her in for a Gastric Dilation Volvulus (GDV) surgery right then. Yes, it was expensive. However, they are a specialized staff that are available at all hours of the night to care for your animals. We love our Finnley like she is no less important than any other member of our family. No doubt about it, she would have died. No matter the cost, we would have paid it. However, they were extremely fair. We paid the $3k right then but received nearly $800 back as a refund when we picked her up a couple days later. They didn't have to do that! We would have been none the wiser that they didn't need the entire amount and I believe it shows what great and honest people they are. I felt especially compelled to write this review because from what I've read, nearly all of the "negative" reviews are price related.

The staff kept us in the loop every step of the way and even allowed us to come sit with her the following day and walk her around a little bit. We were even able to drop off a couple of our tshirts, treats and a bag of her food to see if that would spur an appetite. I have nothing but gratitude for this staff and facility! Our Finnley is happy, healthy and back to our family all thanks to them.

resp.text: You have no idea how grateful we are that Finnley is doing well now.  We also received your kind note too and it was also appreciated.  Emergency medicine is difficult and clients like you make it worth it.  Thank you for taking the time to share your story with us.  We were glad to meet you but sorry for the circumstances surrounding our meeting.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to assist you in the future.

name: Sally M
text: Spent $4000 on back surgery on our 4 year old dachshund.  Brought  her home two days after surgery. Died two days later. Never told why. Dog was completely paralysis (front & back legs). Wish we had never had the surgery. Her back legs would have been paralzed, but she would still be alive.

resp.text: I am having a difficult time determining who you are to be sure I address your concerns appropriately.  In general, the surgeon discusses and goes over prognosis before proceeding with surgery.  Dachshunds are prone to have herniated discs and sometimes the herniation itself can damage the cord beyond what can be corrected surgically.  It sounds like this could have been the case with your pet.  If you are willing, I would invite you to contact our office so that we can talk to you about what happened and provide you with the answers you are seeking.  I am very sorry for your loss and would like to help if we can.

name: Joe Lashley
text:
I firmly believe that Dr. Martin is responsible for the death of my little boy Duke, through greed and/or negligence.  I believe he was more concerned about how many surgeries he could do that day and how much money he could make.  Duke is a Miniature Dachshund.  They are prone to have back problems.  When he was 11 years old he woke me up about midnight in pain.  I took him to SRVS where they gave him a shot.  I spent about $200 then.  The next morning, he was still in pain so I took him back.  They gave him narcotics and put him on an IV of fluids.  He did not have access to water, otherwise. I believe they gave him too much narcotics because he was howling and did not even recognize me when I went to see him.   After a quick diagnosis, they said he needed surgery on his back near his neck.  They couldn’t do surgery right away because he was dehydrated.  Dr. Martin admitted they did not give him sufficient fluids. They told me they would have to do a Myelogram.  I specifically asked Dr. Martin “What are the dangers?”  He remarked that he may hit a bone (vertebrae) and have to move the needle.  He did not say anything else or tell me of any complications.  When I confronted Dr. Martin about his answer regarding complications, his remark was “My bad”, meaning himself that he didn’t inform me.  That was no consolation. Duke also had seizures that I was never told could occur.  When I got upset about that, his daughter got all high and mighty like I had done something wrong.  It was only later in talking with friends that I realized how dangerous this procedure was.  In my opinion they did not take necessary precautions when administering the Myelogram, such as keeping his head elevated so that it didn’t go to his brain.  The next day they took him outside to potty but said he just wanted to sit down.  This was the second lie I was told.  In actuality, his hind legs were paralyzed from the Myelogram.  Then his liver and kidneys started failing.  They put him on an IV to try to regain function but it was too late.  On the discharge papers they told their third lie.  They said that he was standing on his own.  At that point I took him to his regular Vet where they tried desperately to save his life.  The damage had already been done.  I took him home.  I took him outside and he took two wobbly steps and that was the last time he walked.   Duke lost his dignity and his pride when he lost control of his bowels and bladder.  I had to have him put to sleep the next day because of what I believe was negligence by Dr. Martin.  That just about killed me.  I knew my little boy had a few good years left.  He never reimbursed me for the surgery he never performed which to me shows just how greedy he is.  I took him to small claims court just to show him that there are consequences.  He didn’t need a lawyer because the judge argued his case because he was a “Professional”.  Professional or not, he lied in my opinion. I spent about $5000 at SRVS.  Of that about $3000 was for surgery.  Dr. Martin never reimbursed me a single penny for surgery that was NOT performed.  I still mourn the loss of Duke.  My only solace is that he is in Heaven.
Everything I’ve expressed here is my opinion but I believe everything to be truthful.

name: CANDICE LANCASTER
text: I have read all the negative reviews and felt compelled to give my experience which was quite different. I do admit when I first called this clinic the receptionist answering the phone was extremely unpleasant but do to the fact that this is the only clinic for emergency, my husband and I didn't let that deter us. Dr. Loral Sayre..the vet on duty was wonderful and seemed to really care...she sent us home to watch my Dachshund who unfortunately digressed thru the night and needed surgery next day. Dr. Martin did the surgery and was overwhelmingly compassionate and understanding...even MORE important he did an excellent surgery with outstanding results...we are 2 days post op and my dog is recovering remarkably. The staff was very welcoming and I must say I would not hesitate..GOD forbid...if I have another medical emergency to return to this clinic.

name: Rick Bendinger
text: Very good experience they were able to take care of my pets emergency issues in a very professional and timely manner completely satisfied

resp.text: Thank you Rick for the kind words.  We hope that Augie continues to do well but please let us know if we can be of future assistance.

name: Danielle Barton
text: I took my Standard Poodle in for vomiting on 1/15/17.  The receptionist behind the counter Marsha was overwhelmed because there were numerous emergencies going on that night, but deposite the overwhelmingness she remained extremely friendly and helpful.  The female veterinary that we was was amazing and extremely helpful with treating my baby.  A lot of people complain about the price,  but to me it was well worth it to help me baby.  Remember this when complaining about prices... this staff could be at home with their families and loved ones,  but instead they are saving animals nightly without complaint.  It makes me feel better as a pet owner that there is a place like this!

name: Greg Howard
text:
If you're in the Wiregrass area of Alabama and need an emergency veterinarian, I highly recommend Southeast Regional Veterinary Services on Westgate Parkway in Dothan.

Last weekend our three-year-old laborador retriever was bitten by a snake. We didn't see it happen, but we noticed his leg swelling up very badly by about 1:00 p.m. Sunday afternoon.

They got Chip in fast, did bloodwork to check how far the venom had progressed and affected him, and gave him prescription meds and sent a report to our regular vet. All within one hour.

And they really knew how to deal with a scared and injured dog.

They were great and worth every penny.

resp.text: Snake bites can be fatal and we are so glad Chip did well.  Thank you for trusting us with his care and know that we are here if you need us again in the future.

name: Joe F. Watson
text: They demand/require cash up front or they will let your pet die. No negotiation. The veterinarians in our area have done us a disservice by supporting this place.

resp.text: Mr. Watson, thank you for expressing your concern.  I cannot confirm that you visited our hospital.  If you would like to call and discuss this matter, I would be happy to do so.  We can be reached at 334-699-7787.

name: Sue Rendon
text: The prices are criminal. $2000 to remove a few bladder stones on a Saturday?  Two years ago Dr Stembridge did it all for $350. My baby will suffer until Monday. Where's the compassion?  It's all about the money.

name: ralph mcdaniel
text:
The bloodwork ordered on my initial visit, did not get processed. I was billed however. then asked to bring my dog back in to have more blood drawn, then told no the blood had been sent off then told no it really did need to be drawn again. They were clueless.And hesitant to refund the charge for the bloodwork until I spoke with the manager over a week after my initial visit.
This is a poorly run place that seems to do a good job of caring for the animals. While overpriced, they are nice vets. Use at your own risk.

name: miriam sexton
text: I knew since Thursday, the 2nd of July, that I was fixing to lose my 19 year old Himalayan female baby.  She had stopped eating and was barely able to drink anything.  I was selfish and tried to hold onto her as long as I could.  But Sunday, I could not handle it anymore, she started seizing and I had to take her in to be put to sleep.  She was the last of 3 kitties that lived to be 20 and 17 years old.  The people and doctor were great in my time of loss.  Thanks to everyone who works there to help with my baby to cross over the rainbow to be reborn again with God.

name: R Craig
text:
After reading the reviews about this hospital I was compelled to counter. Sounds to me like most of the folks were in seek of free advice. If you need after hours emergency care, you can certainly expect to pay for it. The first time I called this clinic was late at night on a weekend and I agree, the person I spoke with was definitely determined to get my commitment to pay if a Vet was coming to meet me. How many of you would get up at 3:00 AM on a Sunday morning and go to your office if you were not going to get paid? I can only imagine the frustration they experience when pet owner has a possible emergency but yet balks when expected to pay to have their pet treated. It is very expensive to obtain the education necessary to cure animals of diseases and to fix them surgically. Should they do it for free? Is it wrong to make money? There's a difference between a business and a charity. Some evidently don't realize that.

I was thrilled with the care my dog received. Yes it was expensive!! So what, they saved my dogs life...Dr. Martin removed an insulinoma- a tumor from his pancreas and inspected his lymph nodes, liver, etc. for signs of spreading.
A major surgery that included over 48 hours in the hospital. should I complain about the bill? Should it have been cheap? If your child had cancer would you look for the cheapest oncologist? Of course not. The doctors at STVS are kind, patient, and most importantly skilled. If I went to College for a decade and spent God knows how much money on those degrees, I would like to think I would be well compensated for my expertise. Try calling a surgeon at your local people hospital and asking them if you should come into the hospital or not? Come on folks....everything related to medical care, animals or people, is expensive. If you had gone in and paid the 250,  you would have received very good care for your animal!!! Thank you to Dr. Martin and the entire staff! You guys were awesome from the moment we walked in the door. :)

name: Phyllis Dickens
text: They took really great care of my dog.

resp.text: Thank you for posting!  We are glad to be here for you.

name: Matthew Spence
text: I only put one star cause I couldn't put 0. We took our pet rabbit Phil in Saturday cause he had a back injury. I understand he's a rabbit and most people or vets don't consider them as important as a dog but he was important to us. I got there and was made to wait almost an hour with him partially paralyzed and seizing. Then I paid the $112 fee to be seen up front and waited some more. The vet came to the front a few times and never spoke to me other than awe that's sad. I didn't know she was the vet till I was finally seen. Then she looked at Phil for about 60 seconds and said his back is broken, I could take your money and do an x-Ray but I recommend putting him down. We discussed the options then I said let's put him out of his pain. I was then made to go pay more money ($16) to have his suffering ended. Then I waited awhile while they tortured him and blew out the veins in his front legs trying to euthanize him. That didn't work so they took him to the back and I got to hear him scream as they jammed a needle into his heart to put him down. Then they put him in a box handed him over and said we're sorry have a nice day.  Don't take your pets to these people.

name: Allen Bell
text:
Dr. Martin was awesome. Our anatolian shepherd had OCD surgery and all went well.

We had an 8 week check up post surgery for Xrays and received another bill. Nothing cheap either 157.00 to ensure the healing was correct. This was very unexpected especially after what the initial Xrays and surgery cost. I have never had a follow-up after surgey that I paid for on myself, so maybe they are chasing the money.

Again nothing but kind words can be said about Dr Martin.

2 out of 5 stars because the fee for the post op was not discussed.

name: Delane Deshazo
text: I call the vets office when my dog attacked my bird and was told by management told me no one could see my bird today i called every other vets office in the area the only other vet that could have seen him was an hour and a half away . And he has died

resp.text: I apologize for your loss.  I am management and was not consulted about this.  While I am not sure what transpired, I find it unusual that our staff would make that comment.  Feel free to reach out to me in the morning and I will be happy to hear what happened.

name: sharon somnitz
text: Brought my dog in who was not eating or drinking,  and had a swollen ear. Was told the ear was a hematoma and that it was resolving it self. Was told he had abdominal pain and that they would run dianogstics, I left him for a few hours also spent over $700. I had to take him to my regular vet which had been faxed all the paperwork to run more tests... turns out my vet found fang marks on his ear.... instead of a possibility of infection and other guesses,  it was a snake bite. After my vet gave him the proper care  and less than a $100 he is up and running, and a good as new! Do not take your furry baby to these people unless it's a last resort.

name: Wurlitzer Y
text: not a good experience.  non existent compassion and care during an emergency.  just...how do you want to pay.

resp.text: Sir, I was in the middle of responding to your post and it has since changed.  I will address your previous comments.  Your pet passed away eight months ago.  We have tried reaching you during that time and your voicemail was not accepting voicemails.  To your own admission this evening, you blocked our number which would explain our difficulty reaching you.  We only release and give updates on remains by phone since we value compassion and know how difficult losing a pet can be.  We safely stored your pet's remains for eight months hoping that you would come back for them or call for an update.  Thank you for coming by this evening to retrieve your pet's remains.  Though you were disappointed with your experience, we are thankful we were here to help you in your time of need.

name: Virginia Scruggs
text: This review is not based on their service or does not reflect the doctors of this Veterinary Practice.  I have come across a very disturbing video on Vine that has this Veterinary Practice tagged as the place.  The video is of a technician playing with an amputated arm of an animal.  When others commented that they did not feel this post was appropriate, this person used extremely foul and derogatory language. As a veterinary technician myself, I feel like this is very disrespectful to the family of that animal who is now suffering without a limb.  And it is extremely unprofessional to post such derogatory language while you are representing your place of work.  It utterly shocks me that this type of behavior is tolerated.

name: Sandy Jean
text: My cuz was just there today and while (ment for human hospital) the black lady was given narcotics for bone pain,& a NOW former employee of my brother business was there yesterday FOR SAME THING, no broken bones,  was given narcotics, because a toren rotor cuff is extremely painful, my next move, Attorneys. We sued, & won last case, & i"ll sue again. Taking my cuz to real hospital, where they aren't rude to a pastors wife. P.S:u forget donations to domestic violence shelters, or homeless shelters!

resp.text:
Hi Sandy,

We are a veterinary practice and believe you may have meant this review for a completely different facility.

Respectfully,
Scott Burton

name: Graham Ernst
text: I was recommended by another veterinary near Fort Rucker to see SRVS due to the fact they couldn’t accommodate larger dogs on their x-ray table. Naturally, I didn’t had much of a choice b/c of my dog issue. The desk clerk seemed to be new at her job b/c she continued to ask surrounding vet specialist for help on every question that I asked. After basic paperwork, I was hit with an itemized bill that was x2 the cost for normal OFA x-rays and submission fees. I also had to write down my credit card information on the OFA paperwork for additional reading and filing fees (In which, I learned later this is false). Now, I fear about my credit card information. I questioned everything with little to no help. Faced with little choice at the time, I continued with the process. Before they took my dog, they asked me if I had any questions before they begin. I ask how are they going to evaluate my dog’s legs to determine if it’s a soft tissue or ACL damage. They replied by saying during sedation they would flex my dogs legs by feeling for full range of motion. I, again, ask how is that going to determine anything since my dogs muscle is relaxed and limped. That answer didn’t settled well with me. In the mist, the desk clerk wanted me to pay upfront for the entire procedure. I questioned this action since it was unusual. She replied that it is company policy and we would credit your card if any after the procedure. I told her that I wasn’t leaving my dog during his sedation (previously showed her my military card to validate personal information) and my dog is microchip with corresponding information. After the x-rays, the veterinary physician went over the x-rays. He didn’t give me any answers to why my dog was having issues with his rear legs. However, he kept on saying that German Shepherds are prone to hip dysplasia. This was his go to answer for everything. He didn’t provide recovery recommendations, treatment, potential future issues, or anything. I felt like I was rushed after they finished the x-rays. After paying that high bill, I asked if they had a dog gurney to ease my dog’s problem but nothing. The following day (today) I reviewed this situation with the on post vet. They were shocked and surprised by the entire process. Now, I am in the process to black list them from post. BE ADVISED IF YOU GO HERE.

name: Christa Berkowitz
text: Horrible ppl.  Rude uncaring disrespectful.  DO NOT COME HERE

name: Jane Lambert
text: Do not take you're pet there tues are horrible heartless cold people they let my 8 month baby die they could have saved her

name: Andrea White
text: Very friendly, helpful, & excellent care.

resp.text: Thank you for your review of our business.  It is good to hear that we are meeting our client's needs.  Please let us know if there is more we can do to assist you in the future.

name: Amy “Dorkyndaft” Nelson
text: Fabulous staff and very caring!

name: June Green
text: Very rude vet Techs during an emergency with your pet dying

name: Madison Carter
text: Paid bunches of money for me to get my dog back and he is still throwing up and not eating and won’t even take the medicine that the doc prescribed for him called them back to tell them and they were very very rude to me to say the least.

resp.text: I have looked and we do not have a Madison Reynolds in our system.  Did you use another name or are you sure you are contacting the correct practice?  Regardless, please call us so that we can understand and clear up any confusion.  334-699-7787

name: Lynda Anderson
text: Took my. American bulldog there was told her injuries were minor and needed to wait till the emergencies were done first was given a bill of 675.00 my bulldog suffered severely for 6 hours before she painfully passed away ,don't bring your dog here they didn't even apologize instead said I should've given them more money for testing they said she didn't need !!!   Very disturbing!!!

resp.text: I am sorry for your loss of your pet and would like to discuss this with you more over the phone if that is something you are willing to do.  We do triage cases based on severity and I do not know the specific cases that were there that night or the specifics of your pet's clinical presentation that would have caused the veterinarian to treat other cases before yours.  Scott is the Hospital Administrator and he would be the one to speak with to explore what happened.  Again I am sorry for the passing of your pet and wish you comfort during your time of grief.

name: Michael Skinner
text: Offers after hours vegetarian care

name: Robin Ann
text: Dr. Ellison TRULY cares about animals! I love that she will give you options and explains different types of treatments. Her prices are reasonable and affordable. Thank you also to the wonderful staff that are friendly and courteous----Debbie is always so sweet!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review of Calera Animal Hospital! We are so lucky to have the best client's and patient's around!

name: Consuella Griffin
text: The staff did a thorough job with Sandie. They we're gentle with her and explained what they we're doing the entire time. I have no complaints and my visit was everything that I expected. I  wish they pave the lot.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review we just loved having Sandie in the clinic!   Also we appreciate your suggestion of the parking lot and we will be discussing that.

name: Malissa Porter
text: Wouldn't take a goldfish back to this place!! They basically demanded we neuter our dog in order to remain patients of theirs. After having the surgery and developing complications from it (bloody vomiting and stools), they refused to except responsibility- stating complications were probably due to "stress of him being boarded" then tried to charge us for another office visit to diagnosis further, and we have yet to receive a call back with his test results. Charges are much higher than any other vet in the area, and their customer service is blatantly absent. We asked for an itemized receipt and we're told they didn't have time to do that because the phones were ringing off the hook. I DO NOT  RECOMMEND THIS VET, period!

resp.text: We are so sorry you felt the need to express your extremely fabricated opinions in this manner.  As we both are aware these statements are completely  false and should you have been uncertain about wanting your highly aggressive canine neutered it was your choice to choose to have that done.  Our doctors allowed you the option to continue as a client as long as we were able to keep our staff safe.  Our reputation speaks for itself and as always we have an open door policy of speaking personally with the owner and/or the practice manager when you began to feel distressed.  It is your freedom and right to use other vets and we will respect that choice.  We wish you and your canine nothing but the best in the future.

name: Joey H
text: Great staff!! In and out quickly.

name: Metro Pcs
text: Wonderful! They took Great Care Of Bella! Very well prices. Could've been more nice from the receptionist to the Vet.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review of Calera Animal Hospital.  We are so happy you had a wonderful visit.

name: Jill Wegener
text: Went for x-rays and got them at the price quoted. Dr. Ellison was awesome! I would definitely recommend her! Even better, they offer laser treatment, which you can't find at many vets in our area (at least that I have found).

resp.text: We are so glad you had a great experience with us! Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital.

name: Chandra Johnston
text: I have taken my dog and my cat here.  They are wonderful!!!

name: Mike Short
text: Great place. Everyone loves animals amd treats ours so well. The veterinarians are fantastic.

resp.text: We are so glad we can be here for you and your pet's. Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital!

name: Krissy Davis
text: Friendly staff. They took good care of our cat.

resp.text: Thank you for your outstanding review of Calera Animal Hospital! We appreciate you and your fur baby choosing us!

name: Cathy McNeil
text: Other than taking a long time, the people were great

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review of Calera Animal Hospital. We are sorry your visit took a little longer with multiple animals. We will definitely work on that for our future appointments!

name: Jennifer Truncali
text: From the time we walked through the door,  the office staff, vet tech, and veterinarian were very pleasant,  informative,  and professional.  They took the time to explain everything and were very gentle with our cats.  We switched to this clinic from another because of staff attitude issues.  Thank you so much for a great check-up!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Calera Animal Hospital. We are so happy that you and your cats choose us to be your vet. We love getting to know not only the patient but the owner as well. We want you to feel welcomed and informed from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave. Thank you again for leaving us an amazing review!

name: dennis smith
text: Great friendly staff with excellent care for the animals.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review of Calera Animal Hospital. We love taking care of your sweet fur baby!

name: Jessica Wallace
text: I have used them twice for chickens. I love Dr. Ellison and staff. Very good vet and very reasonable.

resp.text: We are so happy that we can be here for you and your chickens! Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital.

name: Carrie
text: My cat may have had an allergy to the flea medicine they prescribed. I asked them if they could exchange the 2 month supply that I had already purchased for a different type of cat flea medication and they said they had nothing else, they only prescribe one thing. I tried  a different vet in Alabaster, and was offered several other types of cat flea medications that I could try out to see if any of them would be a better fit.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to express your view.  We understand your frustration and had hoped by offering a return of the product you purchased and also offering to do a special order for a different type of preventative would have been acceptable for you.  Unfortunately we simply cannot sell canine flea and tick medication for a feline as you requested since they are dosed differently.  We are happy and grateful to hear however that another veterinary clinic in an adjacent city was able to assist you and your fur baby.

name: Rhonda Ellison
text: New remodeled facility and caring individuals who love their job.

name: Rick Bradley
text: This place has messed up 2 of my dogs! I tried to call in today and Jessica was rude from the beginning I said, crying I don't like to complain but I've had two dogs to come back within 6 to 8 months after extractions with more teeth to rotting. I found this in October I had to raise the money till now so I actually found rotting teeth 3 months after the previous extractions. This has become a pattern. There is no way u didn't see this K- 9. Not to mention the gapping hole. Surgery says everything not a fake smile!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking time to review our clinic.  Unfortunately when a client calls not knowing what year and animal they have concerns about our hands are tied on what we are able to help with.  We are so sorry that you are continuing to threaten our staff, call our clinic non stop with vulgar language and lies by continuing a blatant targeted attack of our staff and clinic.  We truly tried to help you, our PM went above and beyond to help even after the disgusting language you used.  However we are hopeful that you will be able to find a different veterinarian clinic that will be able to assist you in the future.

name: Kim Porter
text: We Love Dr Ellison!!! My babies would not be here if not for her!

resp.text: We love your fur babies Mrs. Porter! Thank you for a great review!

name: Tina M. I. Wakefield
text:
My last visit wasn't in 2013. The office manager can not be reasoned with. Right down rude. I loved the veterinarians before changes were made. The veterinarian assistant are great and listen.  I see no need to talk to a office manager that has no people skills.  I sincerely wish the veterinarian who deals with equine and is the owner could be contacted preferably face to face.  Watch the billing process. There's a veterinarian not far from this one that has better prices and will work with you especially in emergency situations.  Practice manager maybe what I call the office manager.  I'm also not a child.  I spoil my pets but the term furbabies shows me immaturity. Kindness, can be shown will being a respectable professional. I also expect professionals to understand their are humans involved.
Thankful I've found such office that's professional, reasonable prices and knows there's a human there.

resp.text: ****We appreciate that you have taken time to express that you have found a great clinic for your fur babies, as a veterinary clinic ourselves that is truly all we can ask for.  We love hearing that our 4 legged friends are greatly taken care of.  As for the bantering on our Google review we will not engage as again since your last visit years ago there is new Practice Manager who prides our staff and doctors into having open ears and listening to not only praises but improvements as well.  Should you have any well grounded concerns please as always reach out to us****Thank you for taking time to review Calera Animal Hospital.  We are sorry you did not have a good experience at your last visit in 2013.  We have made many changes in the last 7 years and would like to right any concerns or issues you had back then.  With a new staff and Practice Manager we are here to help you and your fur babies.

name: Tim Perley
text: Thanks to Dr. Ellison and the wonderful staff for helping us with a goat "emergency". Really helped us with a medication that worked well.

resp.text: We are so glad that we could help you! Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital.

name: Patricia Spigner
text: Calera animal they are a good place to take your pets they  take good care them

resp.text: Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital. We are so happy that you trust us with your fur baby!

name: Cathy Snyder
text: There prices have gone up. It's not the same vet. I felt it was very impersonal.  And all they want was money for the removal of skin tags. I'm taking him to another vet for a second opinion.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking time to review Calera Animal Hospital we understand that needing 4 mass removals and screenings done can be unexpected and very costly.  Please know that you can always call and speak to our Practice Manager about options regarding how to pay for the services needed.

name: Dave Wilson
text: Great people!!! staff and docs are the best  .Always friendly and glad to see you. We have been using them for 5 years after we moved to alabaster wouldn't go anywhere else. All of our pets love going and so do we.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write such a sweet review for Calera Animal Hospital. We are so happy that we can be your vet for your babies.

name: Stephanie TheAnimeLover
text: They truly care for the animals. Best place around here to take a dog.

resp.text: We are so glad you had a great experience while visiting us!  Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital.

name: Mike Scaff
text: Friendly staff , good service .

resp.text: Thank you for your outstanding review of Calera Animal Hospital!

name: Buddy Smith
text: Always happy to see Beth , she takes of our paper work and does a good job scheduling our needs for SOS Beagle Rescue.

resp.text: Thank you for your review of Calera Animal Hospital!

name: donna deavers
text: They are very caring. They go above and beyond for animals in need of care.

resp.text: Thank you for your outstanding review. We are so glad you had a great experience at Calera Animal Hospital.

name: star gray

Kathy Bailey

name: Ashley Johnson
text: This place seems to be way more expensive than most other places. Some of the treatments they insisted on seemed unnecessary and by the time it was all taken care of the bill was outrageous and a huge burden for our family. The flea and tick medicine they used was ineffective and I had to turn around and buy bravecto a month later which worked within hours. Next time we experience an emergency we will be traveling elsewhere to a place with more reasonable prices and a payment plan.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  Striving for excellent communication between staff and clients are a daily goal.  We appreciate your most resent visit and apologize that you did not have a great experience.  Unfortunately when over the counter flea products are requested we do not set those prices, simply the manufacturer does.  We are however able to give a written estimate of needed products prior to purchase to avoid any surprises and we also have an online store that allows clients the opportunity to price these products.  I would like to offer assistance if you are unhappy with the product purchased you can contact our Practice Manager regarding how to reach the manufacturer.  Again we apologize your feeling of a financial burden please know we do offer options such as Care Credit, combined service discounts and monthly specials should you need them in the future.

name: Amanda Bradley
text: The first week of Feb. One of my dogs hit her mouth and knocked her K-9 loose. Which caused her little face to swell. I was soooo upset when I went in. They calmed me down. She was sedated had some teeth pulled. She's just fine. 2 days later my 14yr. old scooter his face was swelled from bad teeth. The surgery was rougher bc he is old. Just takes a little longer to heal. I would give these people that work there 10 stars if I could. I can't stress the importance of keeping your animals teeth brushed or cleaned. If not they die a horrible death by infections! If u have ever had tooth ache they feel the same pain! I've learned my lesson! Thank you for saving my sweet fur babies! Dr. Ellison, Dr. Neal, Jessica Purvis and all the staff at Calera Animal Hospital are heaven sent❣️😇😂 THANK YOU

name: wesleymckeller26
text:
I have taken my dogs to Calera Animal Hospital for years now. I have spent a lot of money there as well.
They actually saved one of my dogs life around 5 years ago and I am very grateful for that. It seems like the last few times I have visited this Vet, they seem like they are more Interested in the money than they are the animal. This has become the norm for the past few years now. I recently had one of my dogs put to sleep there because he had a severe case of cancer. The staff was very sympathetic however I have recently learned that the way the put an animal down Is identical to an animal shelter.  They do not sedate the dog or cat before hand. They just inject the shot and your animal dies in front of you within a few seconds. This moment has haunted me since I have witnessed it. I have inquired at other vets and they ALL sedate before lethal injection to keep the dog from panicking and the owner at greater peace.
Calera Animal Hospital does not do this so please beware.  Plus they asked me to pay the bill before they performed the injection..considering the amount of money I have spent there I was very surprised at this action. I unfortunately will be looking for another vet for my future business

name: Jarred Henderson
text: I owe everything to the staff of Calera Animal Hospital, they saved my cat Lucy from death and no words can describe how grateful I am. name: Katie McKeller
text:
We have used Calera Animal Hospital for many years. All of our animals have been patients of this practice. There has been a steady decline of customer service. We had a dog injured 5 years ago due to a dog attack and they handled that situation with the upmost love and respect. We paid for MONTHS of laser treatments to heal our dogs open wounds. This was after we spent money on several surgeries to help with the extent of her injuries.
This past week we had to make the difficult decision to have one of our pets put to sleep. He had terminal cancer and they offered no treatment plan for him. My husband took him in for an appointment for euthanasia. He told me the method they used to euthanize him, and it was not the standard as to other local facilities. Our pet was not sedated at all. They immediately administered the shot to stop his heart- which within 3 seconds our beloved family pet fell over in my husband’s arms. As hard of a decision as it was, this small act made it so much worse. We felt this was not correct procedure and actually inquired with other local veterinarian offices. They in fact confirmed our suspicions. We will no longer take our other pets to their office, and in good concience cannot recommend them. We are heartbroken over the way our sweet boy was taken from us and do not wish this experience on another pet and their family.

name: connor boyd
text: It stinks animals Lee everywhere but help your dogs alot i would recommend it

resp.text:
While we recognize you taking time to review our clinic and sincerely appreciate that you would recommend us for prospective new clients, we are certainly perplexed over your comments regarding the smell and one star.  We take great pride in providing our clients and patients with a clean atmosphere, and smells of seasonal candles.
Our Practice Manager was hoping to email or contact you directly to discuss your concerns as she believes in using all criticism good and/or bad as teaching tools, however we have been unable to locate that you have visited our clinic.  Please feel free to contact our clinic at any time.
