name: Victoria Evans
text: I have been taking my pets to Dr. Allen Averette for more than 20 years. He is caring and spends a lot of time with patients. He is experienced, professional, intelligent, and down to earth. Dr. Averette does not push medications or procedures, but tries to give balanced options. When my dog had a bad eye problem, Dr. Averette treated it but immediately referred me to vet eye specialist in Birmingham. No medical practice is perfect, and there are an infinite number of variables to make each patient and situation different. Office manager Kam is excellent, very knowledgeable, nice, and organized. I am always surprised that she even remembers my dog's name! Great location, easy access from downtown Tuscaloosa or Northport. Stand alone clinic so no busy traffic or huge parking lot. Nice waiting room split into 2 smaller separate areas, as well as couple of outdoor seats. Recommend making appointment if possible!

name: Mariel D
text: I absolutely love Dr. Averette. He tells you exactly what's wrong and how to fix it. No run around. Also, I can call at any time for advice before deciding if I should take my pups in. I have recommended so many others to this vet and they love it too!

text: I brought my dog in for daycare a couple of weeks ago and he was still full of energy and reeked of urine after getting him home that afternoon. name: Chuck Hester
text: When our pet (Annie) was hit by a car on Saturday afternoon I called your office on Chantilly after business hours and was connected to an emergency number. After explaining the situation to the young man, he took my contact information and said I would be contacted as soon as possible. Within minutes I received a call from your technician who told me to bring Annie to your hospital ASAP. When we arrived at your offices, we were met by three techs and a doctor who started examining and treating her immediately. All of you staff were professional, proficient, and above all else, caring. I would especially recognize Dr. Jane Sead for the care she is providing Annie in an effort to save her front leg which was severely damaged by the accident. Dr. Snead is very calming and appears to really care about her patients. We've found ourselves a new vet for all our pets!  Thanks to the Goodwin Animal Hospital staff for treating Annie and us so well.

name: Juan Marquez
text: Love this place ...... Great Staff.... My ferret was sick and no other vets would see him without a appointment.... I called Goodwin and they gave me an appointment to see him right away.... Doctors and staff really cares.... THANKS!!!

name: Jessica Adams
text: If I could give them zero stars I would. I trusted Goodwin with my dog over Memorial Day weekend I was told he was up to date on all his shots by Brittany. When I arrived the receptionist Heather told me that he needed an annual shot and that my total would be $134.00. So I told her okay even though Brittany told me he didn't need any shots. I would just have to pay to board my dog for the weekend. When I go to pick my dog up he has fleas! Also my bill was $200 not $134.00. I asked the older Caucasian Veterinarian that greeted me by the wrong last name why two of employees Brittany and Heather gave me the wrong information he didn't care. He told me my dog needed all the things I was charged. Like it was my fault not the employees. I had to tell him what happened twice so that let me know he wasn't listening or paying attention. To sum it up DO NOT TRUST THIS VET THEY ONLY CARE ABOUT $$$$ and the employees don't know how to do their job.

name: JTF “Ty”
text: We were in a position where our vet had moved to a location that was not convenient for us and we had been shopping around for recommendations. Having known Dr. Goodwin through community activities along with his reputation and recommendations from current clients, we knew we wanted to trust our pets' care there. A situation arose where our youngest and smallest dog was having some apparent GI distress and we called the clinic and Dr. Goodwin took our call and discussed the situation and had us come in. That is a level of customer service you don't ordinarily see from professional-level providers like doctors, lawyers, dentists and veterinarians.  We were greeted by kind and caring front office and technical staff and our pet's issues were addressed in a caring and professional manner. The approach was also conservative rather than a rush to run a litany of tests and get x-rays that might not have been warranted. And it turns out they weren't. After an overnight stay for our pet, we were promptly followed up with by Dr. Goodwin even though it was his day off. We were discharged under the care of Dr. Sterenberg with the same caring and thoroughness of Dr. Goodwin. Our only regret is that we learned during our visit that Dr. Goodwin was retiring and he was the main reason we chose the clinic as our new pet care provider.

name: James Sheppard
text:
The staff at Goodwin Animal Hospital has cared for our two cats the past 8 years, and our dog several years prior.  I am not qualified to judge the competence of the vets or support staff as some previous writers felt compelled to do, but I do know that our pets have been treated with kindness and concern, and whatever ailment that any of them had was cured when they left.  You can't argue with success.

We have an older cat that is in the twilight of her years and Dr. Glasscock has been unfailingly attentive and gentle with her on the many occasions we have had to seek help from her.  She is a credit to what I consider a very fine group of people.  The practice is operated as business and not as as a public service, so they do charge for their services.  Imagine that.  So does our family doctor, the guys who do our yard work and the woman who leaves the newspaper.

I would recommend these fine folks to anyone in need of veterinary assistance for their pets.  I miss talking Auburn football with Dr. Goodwin since he has begun spending his time at the new facility, but we are very pleased with Dr. Glasscock.

text: The staff were friendly and helpful during our visit. The prices were more reasonable than i anticipated, and we were treated very professionally. We will continue to use Goodwin!

text: Been going there 15 years they care about your fur babies

name: Kalyn Pinkerton
text: So my review is from 2014. I took my cat in for a UTI back in November of 2014. He was seen by Dr. Goodwin. I was told he was blocked and had to have a surgery that would basically open up his urethra. So he had the surgery and he came home. He wasn’t getting better. Still in complete pain, losing weight, and straining horribly to use the bathroom. Not only that but he now has a gaping hole in his rear that is exposed to outside air and bacteria and causing infection. We went back to Goodwin in December for them to redo the surgery. Still not successful. At this point he’s being boarded at the Chantilly facility for constant observation. Looking back I’m assuming because they knew they had messed my baby up. So January rolls around and he’s not better. Weight loss, no appetite, and clearly in pain constantly. Dr. Sermon(?) decided to take over and redid the surgery AGAIN.  At this point my cat has been boarded there for over a month and has had THREE SURGERIES. Now I have a cat with constant issues at this point. They said the surgery was effective. WRONG IT WAS NOT. I’ll put a pic in the comments of his rear on the regular due to this complication. He couldn’t even sit down comfortably. He couldn’t walk like a normal cat. And he was constantly crying out in pain and straining. I switched vets at the point and had to spend the next three years of his life at routine visits every 2-3 months to have him sedated and antibiotics and his rear cleaned up. This constant pain eventually took a toll on him. I paid hundreds for prescription food and frequent vet visits and all Goodwin did for me was take a couple grand off my bill and left me with still around a $2k bill for them ruining my cats life. He recently died at only 6 years of age due to his poor quality of life and constant pain and infection caused by this surgery. I’ve investigated this with an attorney and I’m regretful I waited this long as it is outside of the statute of limitations for malpractice or Goodwin would have a lawsuit on their hands. I truly believe they single-handedly ruined my cats life and caused him to be taken from me way too soon. Do not trust these idiots with your babies.

resp.text: Hello Robert - Thank you for sharing your kind words with us regarding our staff at our Montgomery hospital. We hope all is well and thank you for partnering with us.

name: J Johnson
text: Beyond frustrated with appointment policy. We are on the wellness plan, so I cannot switch vets without throwing that money down the toilet. Otherwise I would change in a heartbeat. They are using coronavirus as an excuse to do everything at their own convenience rather than taking into account the needs and wellness of the pets themselves. They make you bring your pet in in the morning and leave it like some sort of work order or car to be worked on when they feel like it and then picked up much later. This is needlessly traumatizing to my cat who hates to be at the vet. It has been over two hours now and still waiting for the vet to even look at the cat. I’m so angry I could cry.

resp.text: Hello - We are sorry to hear about your frustrations with us and with our Optimum Wellness Plans. We are sorry you haven’t had a good experience. May we have an opportunity to address your concerns? – please reach out to our Client Advocate Team at BanfieldCares@banfield.com to discuss options and next steps.

text: Do not let these people talk you into any of their monthly health plans. It is an absolute joke. They say you get a major discount on all services, what they don't tell you is that they are 3 times more expensive and most of the local vets. Then every time I took my dog in there was always some upcharge. I will never be going back in there and will be making sure all my friends do the same. Many of the reviews say they are very nice ... and that is true... people can be nice to you while they screw you.

resp.text: Hi Carl, we are sorry to hear about your frustrations with us and with our Optimum Wellness Plans. We are sorry you haven’t had a good experience. May we have an opportunity to address your concerns? – please reach out to our Client Advocate Team at BanfieldCares@banfield.com to discuss options and next steps.

text: My great dane puppy was in pain and they were able to see him right away rough housing with older sister he got hurt they took great care of him.  Very thankful for the Vet, vet techs front desk.  All were thoughtful and very professional

text: Friendly and very knowledgeable staff! They always take care of my pets when I visit and call to check up on them when yo leave. They are local, convenient,  and get you in a out in a timely manner. Pictured is my guinea pig Reese being treated here. He was calm and trusting with them so that was a good sign! Love this place and their employees ❤

name: Nicole Etheridge
text: I highly recommend the puppy plan and Dr Randall and of course the staff there is great they all love animals and that's what matters

resp.text: Hi Nicole - Thank you so much for taking the time to share your positive experience with Dr. Randall and our Montgomery hospital! We're so happy to hear that you recommend the puppy plan and our staff's care. We hope all is well and will pass your kind words to the team!

name: Kathrine Barker
text: Great staff! Always helpful. I was a member of their dog health plan, but I recently moved to an area without a banfield location. I'm really sad to have left their services...

name: Tammy Harsha
text: The staff is so nice. And they tell you how much everything is up front so no surprises.

name: Ben Cooper
text: The pet plans are well worth the value. There are also plenty of locations if you happen to be traveling.

name: Tiffa
text: Very upset. I took my dog in for a surgery and check up in July. While I was there, they talked me into the monthly wellness plan for my dog. So I chose the $39.95 option. Not ONCE did they tell me it was some sort of contract that I had to fulfill for a year. Not once did anyone tell me I had to pay $39.95 for an entire year, and if I wanted out, that I had to pay the remaining amount. Are you kidding me? I'm cancelling my plan because my dog doesn't need it and I can't afford it. They even told me I could cancel it at any time if I pleased, not once telling me it would charge me for the remaining months. Now I'm stuck with paying the rest of the $480 when I do not want to, and do not need the service. I JUST switched to Banfield too when this happened. Looks like I'll be looking for another vet since they clearly can not be honest and tell me the IMPORTANT information we would need to know. Just sucking money out of you is all it is.

resp.text: Thank you, Tiffa, for taking the time to bring your concerns about the Wellness Plan to our attention. Please reach out to our Client Advocate Team at 877-500-2288 or email internet.inquiries@banfield.com at your convenience so we can try to address your concerns.

name: Judy Broach
text: I have used Dr. Randle for 2 or 3 years.  She has been excellent with my babies.  I have used Banfield’s wellness plans and have no complaints.  Without the plan, the prices are high.  You get a lot for your money with the plans and best of all I get Dr. Randle.  The staff is also very friendly and caring. My only “complaint” is because of COVID-19, I have to drop off. I have never liked to leave my babies.  As a nurse, I understand.

name: Ralph Griffith
text: an excellent place to go to the veterinarian is very very well-mannered very knowledgeable and he took care of a pet dog Charlie he could a tumor off very very well done office Towne and Charlie is healed up within a week would recommend to anyone if you love your pet this is the veterinarian for you!!!

resp.text: Hi Ralph - We are happy to hear that Charlie is recovering nicely.  Please give your pup a hug from us.  Thanks for taking the time to share your feelings about our Montgomery staff.  We will share your comments with them and look forward to continuing to care for your pets.  Be well!

name: Gretchen Perry

resp.text: Hi Gretchen - Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience with Madeline at our Montgomery hospital! We're so happy to hear about the wonderful care she has been able to provide for your family. We'll be sure to pass your kind words along to the team!

name: J Girl Chill
text: The doctors and nurses are super nice. The have a wonderful insurance plan, as well. They really help with the worries that come with getting a new pet.

text: This is a wonderful Banfield that you can take your pet to. Excellent staff and they really take the time to address any concerns regarding your pet. The wellness plan definitely does help cut down some of the cost of services.

name: Danny G.
text: Love Banfield!

name: Bryan Whitefield
text:
Just visited Banfield Pet Hospital, and it was amazing.

Visited this clinic to have my puppy Roger vaccinated. It went well. Everything was fine.

The service though is what it makes amazing. I mean the receiving clerk was very well hands on all the time. From the check in to when we leave. 5 stars for that effort. My puppy was not even stressed for a little bit. The doctor was very skilled. He really knows what he was doing.

The doctor even go for an extra mile by giving some advice on what to feed my puppy and what to not. This will be my first time to raise a dog actually. Yay.

Will really go back here to Banfield Pet Hospital for Roger's updated vaccine. 5 stars for the service. Stay great.

resp.text: Hi Bryan – We're so glad to hear you and Roger love coming to visit us at our Montgomery hospital. Thank you for taking the time to let us know about the positive experience you had. We hope all is well and look forward to seeing you and Roger at his next visit.

text: Everyone at this Banfield is amazing. They knew me and my babies by name. Changing vets was the hardest part about leaving Montgomery. Dr. Randle and Dr. Irrazary were the absolute best. The patience they showed my babies was amazing. I'll never forget it.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive feedback about Dr. Randle, Dr. Irrazary, and the rest of the staff, Shana! We’re happy you enjoyed your experience, and we’ll be sure to pass on your kind words to the Montgomery team!

name: Emma Chemey
text: Thank you, thank you, thank you to the kind and generous staff of Banfield Pet Hospital for helping us out during #HurricaneIrma. We bugged out of Tallhassee early this morning and they were generous enough to board our 3 cats and bunny for free until our room was available at our hotel. We were able to spend the next few hours getting a few hours of sleep, catching our breath, while enjoying the wonderful hospitality of Montgomery. We were so lucky to be able to evacuate and we continue to be so blessed by the goodness of wonderful people making this difficult stressful time as smooth as possible.

name: Chase Chesser
text: Dr. Randle was very helpful in treating our dog. She took us in on very short notice, and we felt very comfortable leaving our dog in her hands. The office called us the following day to check back in on our dog. I highly recommend Dr. Randle and the clinic.

name: Nikissia Craig
text: I drove three hours to have my dog seen at this Banfield in Montgomery after being turned down by closer Banfields. I was out of town on a trip in Alabama when my dog became very ill. The front desk assistant, Pauline made calls for me to try to help with getting my dog seen. After no luck on both our ends, she promised that if I brought my dog there, they would see him. After arriving, I met Teal, who was pleasant and helpful at the front desk. Pauline was great and Dr. Rowe was excellent. Dr. Rowe was thorough and caring. I was clearly in distress when she explained how sick my dog was. She was encouraging, very knowledgeable, and non-blaming. She even counseled on how to prevent another serious incident if possible. By the time I arrived in Montgomery, my dog had a fever of 105.9 degrees and was in danger of hospitalization. Pauline apologized repeatedly for the fact that I had to make a 3 hour drive to get my dog seen. I knew that she had advocated for me, and she was patient with me as I made multiple calls to her for assistance with locating closer Banfields earlier that day.The staff stayed late to try to stabilize my dog, and they showed me and my dog the best customer service and treatment that I've ever had from Banfield. To put their service in perspective, I've been a Banfield customer for six years and in three different states. Even my relative who helped me make the drive stated that she'd be bringing her cat by after witnessing their quality of service.

name: lotlotmonroe
text: They treated us great and stayed after hours to help our doggy

resp.text: We appreciate you telling us about your positive experience with our Montgomery, AL location. We hope that your doggy is feeling better! Thank you for partnering with us for your pet's needs.

name: Stephanie Gardner
text: I've only ever had a good experience with this vet. Two of my three dogs go here, and both are on wellness plans. The staff is always very nice, and I've never had to wait longer then fifteen minutes to be seen (if that).

name: Erika Staiger
text: I've been so touched by the kindness I have met these past few days, but I wanted to say a special thank you to the staff off #banfieldpethospital number 1115, of Montgomery, Alabama. My friends and I arrived in Montgomery with seven hours to go before we checked into our hotel, with two cars full of pets, fresh from the path of Hurricane Irma. They graciously allowed our cats and Dory to stay with them while we waited for our room to be ready so that they didn't have to spend an additional seven hours in the car--this on top of a four hour drive from Tallahassee, and a seven hour ordeal from Tampa for my critters a few days earlier. They fed them, let them use their litter boxes, and gave them lots of love and attention. Best of all, they graciously declined to charge us for the visit. We've been really blessed to have run into so many nice people here in Alabama so far, but I wanted to take a moment to shout out these guys for going above and beyond their call of duty. I don't think any of us will forget this act of kindness any time soon. If you happen to be in need of veterinary services in Montgomery, AL be sure to give these people a call.

name: Cynthia Chesterfield
text:
The care my pet received was adequate.  Nothing special, but adequate.  You can tell the staff have been through extensive sales training from the way they push the Wellness plan (starting at $500 per year per pet).  They avoid answering questions about how much the items covered in the wellness plan actually cost, which is why I politely told them no each time they brought it up (on average 3 times per visit).

What has made me decide to NOT use them again is the number of follow up exams they required (beyond the industry standard according to 3 other vetinarians).  Each of these follow up exams was another $30 (not including medication, scrapings, etc).  All 3 of the other vets said that the follow up exam is included in the initial exam costs.  When this was brought to their attention, their response was "Well, YOU chose to bring her back to us.....you didn't have to."   HUH?  You told me it was necessary.  And now that you have my money, you are telling me I was the sucker for bringing her back?  Well, kudos to you.  I am hoping this review keeps other people from being suckered by your glossy advertisements and the "If you really care about your pets you will flush $1000 down our toilets" sales pitches.

Best advice:  STAY AWAY unless you are super rich and are looking for ways to blow some money unnecessarily.  There are too many other vets out there that care about animals AND humans.

P.S.  Please don't give me the Public Relations approved "spin" response we see below ("we strive to provide our clients and their pets with high quality medicine and exceptional client experiences on every visit").  Put your money where your mouth is and then talk to me (that means refund the last 2 visits minus the meds!).

name: Misty haskett
text: Dr Randle and her staff out the best I have ever been to!!

name: Christen Henson
text: This is the best veterinary care around ! Dr Randle is very gentle and sweet with my puppy! Very professional and clean facility!

name: patty rovnyak
text: I took my dog to the vet this afternoon. He had been to the vet two weeks because he had a couple seizures and they thought he had epilepsy and put him on medication. Last night I noticed his belly was turning black in some places. So I took him back in. We saw a different vet. She took a look at the black spot and said she didn’t know what it was, went to see if it could be a side effect from medication. She came back and said no but she said she still didn’t know what was causing the blackness but wasn’t concerned and then spent 20 minutes trying to convince us to buy their wellness plan. So I ended up spending $40 for a sales pitch. Vet could careless about what was wrong with my dog.

resp.text:
Hello Patty, We want you to know that we hear your frustration and dissatisfaction with your experience and would like to learn more about what happened. At your convenience, could you please reach out to our Client Advocate Team with your name, client ID and phone number associated with your account? The team can be reached at 877-500-2288 or by emailing cat@banfield.com. Thanks for bringing this to our attention.
Take care- The Banfield Team

Don’t just say “she’s fine” and you haven’t actually gotten off your butt to check. Other than my last visit, overall I haven’t had any issues.

text: You walked me through the entire process of everything Fynn had and answered all my questions and put my mind at ease. Fynn came through with flying colors and you took great care of my fur-baby. Such friendly, helpful staff!!!! We are both so pleased.

text: We boarded our Bella with this facility over a weekend and they took great care of her. All of the staff was super friendly and you could really tell they LOVE their animal friends. I felt sorry for them at our drop off on Saturday because they were so busy and seemed understaffed. I hope others see a need for more staff here and hire some great people because these ladies were going above and beyond to take care of everyone with the crazy COVID restrictions in place. They never slowed down so I cannot imagine them having to keep this pace every weekend. Our hold time to check in was about 20 minutes but we were happy to wait bc we saw the issue was just not enough hands on deck, nothing else. They were very professional, super sweet, and we are so happy that they will be Bella's new vet facility in Pell City. I highly recommend Pell City Animal Hospital to anyone looking for great animal care.

name: Trina Barrett
text: I don’t do reviews often. Dr. Farmer is a wonderful vet and I have used him for years. However recently we saw Dr. Bearden. I cannot recommend her under any circumstances. My dog had an obvious deformation in her leg after an accident. Dr. Bearden put her in a splint, took X-rays and told us she would send them to a surgeon. Each week we went back and the treatment plan/diagnosis/story changed. The staff would tell me something different than she did each time. She never sent the X-rays to a surgeon. 6 weeks this went on. (Shame on me for letting it go on so long) On the last visit the dog was dropped off 7am, at her request, for observation without the splint. She didn’t look at the dog or remove the splint until I called at 1:30 for an update. At 3:30 she claimed the dog only had “liganitis” but was still not putting weight on the leg. When I asked about the “dent” she claimed I had never told her about it. Not true, and it was easy to see on the dog’s leg. She wanted to give the dog back without a splint. I had the staff splint the leg and took the dog to another vet. She had to have a metal plate surgically implanted to fix the damage. Because of Dr Bearden’s poor diagnostic skills, I cannot recommend PC Animal Hospital unless you see Dr. Farmer.

name: Kisha Lybrand

name: Thomas S
text:
Update:
I recently left a 1 star review for Indian Hills Animal Clinic. At the time I felt that it was completely justified.
Today (August 8) I received a phone call from Dr. Smith. He both explained the delay that I referenced in my original review and apologized for it. Dr. Smith explained that he had been out of town for two weeks. He regretted that his staff did not let me know that. People get busy and forget. I do not hold them responsible. Because of Dr. Smith's sincere (and kind) phone call I feel that a negative review is not warranted. Therefore I have changed my review to an honest competitively positive 5 star. I have also deleted my original review.

name: Bianca M
text:
We had never been here before and needed to leave our dog with Indian Hills over the Thanksgiving weekend. She came back happy and clean (all pets are required to leave with a bath) which was lovely.

However, there were a few problems.

First, there is a gray cat that wanders around in the lobby. I might be a bit more understanding if the cat was relaxed and calm, but it clearly doesn’t like dogs (hissed at ours as soon as it walked in). It was walking all over the counter and floors when we dropped off and picked up, and was actively rubbing itself on the items owners were leaving for their dogs. Everyone in my household has cat allergies, so this was very unwelcome for us. Additionally, not all dogs can handle being around a cat or their scent, and with leashes coming off and on there is way too much opportunity for an attack to happen. That puts people’s dogs AND the cat in danger, which just seems so irresponsible for a clinic/boarding facility.  As we were picking up, we also witnessed this cat suddenly scratch a woman that had been petting it. I know cats can be finicky but what if that had been a child?

Our second issue was that we had to ask where the rest of her items were when we came to pick her up as they weren’t with her bag. Their boarding paperwork requires you list all the items you will be leaving with your pet, so what was the point of filling it out if it doesn’t matter?

Third, we left exactly enough food for our dog to be fed for 6 mornings and 6 nights when we dropped her off Monday morning, so you can imagine our surprise when we saw 2 bags of food left. When we asked the receptionist why she still had food left over, she directed us to someone who might have been feeding her for the time she was there. He said that he and one other person were responsible, yet when we asked he couldn’t explain why there were 2 bags left. First he said he didn’t know, then he said she ate everyday. Which means she either ate someone else’s food or someone didn’t feed her. Either way he clearly didn’t know and didn’t want to get in trouble. We label her food bags because she has to take a fish pill for constipation in the morning(which we leave in the bag) and both bags were morning bags, so that’s 2 days of her stay where she didn’t get her food OR her pill. It’s unacceptable that no one could answer whether or not she had been fed. If she had just not eaten on those days I would understand, but they didn’t even know the answer to that.

I will say that our dog was clearly much calmer and happier at the end of her stay than she has been at other dog boarding facilities, but sadly the other issues will likely keep us from using this facility in the future.

name: Edith Thellmann
text:
I had scheduled about 2 weeks ago an appointment to have my dogs teeth cleaned.
I received a quote in the amount of $180.00. About a week ago the office called me and told
me that my quote was incorrect and that the new quote would be $309.00
Today 03/16/15 the offfice called me again (let the phone ring only once) and told me that the quote
has changed to around $500.00. Now this price doesn't include hospitalization or any extras.
When I let the lady in the office know that my dog will not stay over night she replied; we have
7 surgeries for that day and we can't promise you anything. Which to me means well I guess your dog will stay overnight and you will have additional charges.
I am looking at my quote  which I received about two weeks ago and in the price of $180.00 the
hospitalization for that day is included. Since the teeth cleaning supposed to be done on 03/18/15 I have decided not to go with this animal clinic since I might land up paying more than I should!

name: sara ellington
text: After going to another vet with my first puppy,  leaving with unanswered questions, and not getting the compassion I felt like he deserved from a serious heart condition at his age I decided to go to another vet in Tuscaloosa for a second opinion and I'm so glad I did. Indian Hills was so great to my first puppy and has been just as good my current one. Every time I come in the staff is so friendly and accomidating. They will walk over just to pet him and say how handsome he is. They all clearly love animals and care beyond what just a job would require. I haven't had a single bad experience there that they could help and even when I had to come in to put my first puppy down at 17 weeks old Dr. Smith stayed with me after they closed and let me have my time to come to terms with what was happening while giving me comforting words. Even today when I came in to get treatment for my current puppy they all listened to my concerns about antibiotics destroying all the good bacteria in my dogs stomach and gave me some probiotics to help him. Indian Hills is definitely my go to choice for a vet in Alabama.

name: Clarice Westover
text: DO NOT board your dogs here. The staff is rude, off putting, and clearly does NOT understand dog behavior NOR do they practice stress reducing handling. My usual amazing vet (Animal Medical Center) was booked for the 4th of July holiday so I had to take my 2 dogs here. Upon dropping them off the vet tech removed both of their collars which I found VERY unusual. I asked and they said it was for safety? NEVER have my dogs’ collars been removed when they were boarded. But alas, it was the rules and I had a vacation to get to. An HOUR after I had left and am well out of town, I receive a call saying that my Great Dane/Pit was “too aggressive” to be boarded with them and “needed to be removed.” I was shocked. Never has this happened at any other boarding place! I drive all the way back and a vet took me back to the boarding area to remove my dog myself! Have you seen the boarding area?? YIKES. The beds and toys I had given them weren’t even in their “kennel” (shelter holding cage it looked more like) and they said some BS about how they had to de-tag everything? Who knows if my one dog even had her things with her during her stay. After collecting my “aggressive” dog, I called AMC and told them what happened. They thought it was ridiculous and made room for my baby! They even LAUGHED when I told them Indian Hills said he was too aggressive. AMC understands dog behavior, Indian Hills does NOT. I even connected with another woman on Facebook who said that her pit mix was refused as well. Breed discrimination? I think YES. If I could give zero stars I would.

name: Nancy Perrine
text: My 2 cats were treated first last summer for flea bite allergy skin problems.  Two brutal summers battling this problem with little help from vets we saw.  I met Jonathan, Vet Tech at Emergivet and was so impressed with his manner that when I found out he also works full time for Dr. Phillip Smith I made a follow up appointment for both cats to be seen.  They changed their topical flea Rx, gave them combination cocktail injections and within a week problems resolved and stayed resolved all summer.  Before we could get our 12 yr old standard dachshund in for a geriatric evaluation as planned, he had to be seen following a first time acute pancreatitis episode that came on when we were traveling. His treatment by Dr.Smith and staff was thorough, compassionate, and confidence inspiring to anxious owners with a very ill dog.  We are happy to have found him and everyone who works there to deliver the vet care we expected but had been unable to find.

name: Brandon Lee
text: STAY FAR AWAY!! they are all smiles with bad ethics. I would not wish anyone on this horribly ethical place. I had an emergency shortly before they were closing. My dog was seriously wounded and needed medical attention. They looked at her and gave an assessment then told me i needed to take her to the after hours clinic because they were closing. WTH!! What kind of ethical vow did this doctor take?!?! Then they slapped a $600+ bill on me. Are you insane, you just pushed me out the door after an x ray and some pain killers. My dog was dying. It will be my mission to have this doctors(one from a year ago,female, but I'm sure the same lousy staff is there) license revoked. On top of that the sleazy vet tech reported my dog because she bit me while in shock, seconds after she was hit by a car, so after she was eventually put down the state took her from me to cut her open and look for rabies. Which is a backdoor for the government to do animal testing. She had up to date shots and results were negative. STAY WAY !!!

text: We normally used a different vet, but our cat needed to be seen asap and that vet had a 2 week wait. So we went to Abby Creek. They treated her so well. She can be a difficult cat to handle but they handled her with such care. The next week I had another cat that needed to be seen and again they were wonderful with her. We told them that most of our cats are cats that have been dumped and we just fix them and keep them, and that we foster kittens. These awesome folks sent us home with enough ear wash and ear drops for everyone - as opposed to having us bring each one in. To keep this from becoming a novel - we love Abby Creek Animal Hospital and the staff. This is where our animals will be going from now on. Thanks ya'll for all that you do.

name: Danielle Mayo
text: Dr. Sarah Champion is only vet in the Wiregrass area who specializes in equine care. Others will do equine care but don't have the experience and knowledge she has. I did my research  before using her and was due to the fact I had a very rare case going on with my horse I had already had two different vets out to look into for me. This woman does not get far enough recognition for her work in my opinion. Contacted Dr. Champion through email to do a farm call a week before Christmas. It was on suspected foundering. Answered each email with urgency, very late in that evening with concern for an animal she had never encountered. Detailed what to do and not do before she was able to come out for the farm call visit. Worked her in the day before Christmas Eve. Most vets would be on vacation, not taking on new clients during the holidays. Emailed me an estimation of what my visit would cost for her to drive from Abbeville to Dothan to do an exam, blood draw, blood test, xrays and her suspicions on causes my horse was having. De. Champions suspicions were correct on diagnosis also. This woman has saved my horse from going down a very dangerous, miserable rode she may have not been able to recover from. I can not thank this woman enough for her care, experience, knowledge and compassion with my first experience with Abbie Creek Animal Hospital. You have definitely gained a new customer and will be using Dr. Champion for all of June's care from now on. Tank was already a patient of Dr. Champion when I became his new owner and will continue that. All of my animals will now be going to Dr. Champion for their care. I would like to personally say thank you for the care you gave June. Looking into all the different health issues that could have been causing her episodes and setting my mind at ease.

text: I would prefer to not even give them one star. This office gave us bad instructions on after care for our dog after getting spayed there. They gave her a 24 hour pain shot and told us she shouldn't need pain meds after that but if she did give her liquid Tylenol and Ibuprofen, to dose her as a 40lb child. After the day she was still acting like she was in pain so we did what they said not thinking to research before we did because a vets office told us to do it. 3 days after her surgery she was still acting like she was in pain and then started to act like she didn't feel well at all. Called our previous vet to be told ibuprofen and Tylenol are harmful and toxic to dogs and could kill her!! $210 , a very sick dog, another vet visit, and emergency vet visit later and she's finally starting to act like she feels better!! When we called Colbert Animal Clinic back they told us again she could have ibuprofen and Tylenol!!

PS  I want to add to my review I called with a very very sick pet cat that was like my baby my human baby he turned 11 September 5th I kept trying take  him in to the Dr ...they had a answering  machine message he'll be in tomorrow  then then a week had gone bye ,  the Dr  was sick i can understand that, I talk to his wife normally she is very considerate ,  concerning,  caring..she finally answered,, I describe my baby's symptoms and she told me that they couldnot help him I  needed take him to another vet for blood work  and possibly for blood transfusion and a lot of other things , she told me he would die..... then she told me I have other patients I've got to see hung up.... to me that was a little cold hearted , we were going to take him the next day  to another  veterinarian .....now my feelings have changed because he did die my baby boy .   very hurtful because he was a one-of-a-kind cat my baby boy I won't forget this a piece of my heart went with him.......they should have left a message not sure when the Dr will be in ......take your pet to another vet................. the message was very misleading................now we are watching his sister close because it seems she is greaving  over her brother they were born at the same time it's like they were twins..................

name: R S
text:
I was leery of the quality and cleanliness of this veterinarian’s office because of all the “stuff” (aka junk) piled in various spots around the outside of the building.  When I took my animal inside, the stench of litter box odor filled the air.  There was a cat on the receptionist's counter, one on a bench in the waiting room, one behind the receptionist's desk, and I think another cat was present.  I was too shocked to really remember.  When we walked towards the exam room, the smell seemed to be stronger and I noticed things appeared to be dirty.  I declined service and stated we were leaving because it was too dirty and smelly.

I had phoned around for prices on vaccinations, and this place was one of the cheapest.  We recently moved to the area and our small-town vet back home had a building that wasn’t fancy or anything special to look at from the outside.  However, the outside was always clean and maintained, and the inside was spotless.  I hate to judge a book by its cover, but in this case the outside spoke for the inside.  I highly recommend taking your pet elsewhere.  When I left the Colbert Animal Clinic I phoned the Tennessee Valley Animal Clinic, which is located up the highway about a mile.  They offered to work my pet in and were only a few dollars higher.  It was money well spent to have my pet cared for in a clean and well maintained facility.

The staff at the Colbert Animal Clinic seemed friendly and nice, but I was only in there for a couple of minutes.  On the phone the receptionist mentioned they offered kennel services; but after seeing the office, I can only imagine the condition of the garage where they kennel pets.  Do yourself and your pet a favor, spend a few bucks more and drive up the highway to the Tennessee Valley Animal Clinic or another local vet.  Surely there can't be one that is more smelly, filthy, or dirty.

name: Leslie Brown
text:
I agree with the many points of the previous review. The staff was nice and friendly, but the place could use some picking up. As far as first impressions go, many bad ones were made right off the bat.  Upon my arrival, all of the techs were sitting outside smoking which, in my opinion, should be done at the back of the facility.  Upon entering the facility, I also smelled the litter boxes and the smell was so strong that when I left I had to roll my car windows down to air out a bit. There were at least 5 cats on the counter, two of which kept getting in my way to fill out my paperwork and another swatted at me in an aggressive manner for no reason.

The place employs nice people, but they REALLY need to clean up a bit.

name: Bertdell Estep
text: I came to this office pto have my dog neutered after adopting him from the animal shelter. This was the only 1/2 I could choose from that had an opening available in the time frame I needed. The staff was extremely nice however they were all out smoking upon my arrival from drop off and pick up which is super unprofessional in my opinion. The entry way is very messy and the establishment itself was a bit of an eye sore. Arriving I was extremely surprised and almost confused. After entering it was quite a mess. The establishment reaked with the overwhelming smell of ammonia I assume from all of the cats that were running around. It was so bad that I couldn't breathe and my head began to hurt. I was counting the seconds until I could leave because of this... Behind the counter where you could see while filling out paper work was disgusting and unclean to say the least. There were also cracks between the floor and wall caked with dirt and debris as well. There is duct tape holding their scale wires to the wall and numerous random food items and personal items scattered though the shelves of the weight intake area. I was worried to leave my dog here because of the conditions, immediately after leaving I wanted to turn around and bring him home. Though the staff was nice and courteous I will be sure to take my business to a more clean and sterile environment from here on out. My personal preference is Animals Choice in Iuka.

text:
A dear friend told me about Dr.Martin and his team at Parkway Animal Hospital. I was looking for a new vet that wasn’t in it for the money sort of speak, and wasn’t like most vet office, so I gave them a try... LOVED THEM, then I fostered 2 boxers that at the time one was heartworm positive, I consulted Dr.Martin and the first question he asked me was
Are we gonna fight for his best quality of life, I said yep we saving my boy. Soon afterwards my family and I adopted both boxers and they are both heartworm free and living it up!
I can’t say enough about Dr. Martin , Ms. April, and the rest of the Parkway family! This is by far the BEST animal hospital/vet office and extended family members! They are very professional and have the biggest hearts for all animals! I highly recommend for your piece of mine, but most of all, the love, attention, and care are their most important part
Thank you to all

text:
There was no wait even though I was late....
Drama is 9 now and he loves to go there....

name: Therese Fulford
text: My dogs went there since pups until one day I took them in for annuals.  They insisted on taking Charlie to the back for service.  All of a sudden I heard Charlie yelp in pain like I had never heard him do before.  Shortly the tech came in and said that Charlie bit the vet and that the visit was cancelled. Now my charlie wasn't a biter.  They did something to him in the back that MADE him cry out in pain and he probably did bite in defense.  The techs would not comment on what happened. I have never been back.  The vet was Dr long.  Do not take your animals there or if you do don't let them out of your sight!

name: xXHazey DayzXx
text: A vet does what a vet does, I give a 5 star because they helped me and my dog and they did it well.

text: They got my fur baby in for a sick visit within 24 hours. Fast service, we spent no time in the waiting room. Doctor was wonderful!

name: Sylvia Simpson
text: First time taking my 7 month old Labmix here for a checkup and I was very pleased with the service. I was really pleased with the professional and friendly service of the nurse,Molly! She answered all of my questions and concerns,we will be back.

name: Kelly T.
text: Hubby found an abandoned tiny kitten in the road on his way home from work. Since this vet was closer to our home, we took the baby there to get a check up. Dr. Hollinger and his assistant (as well as the desk clerks) were very kind and helpful. We found out the kitten was a girl; she was about 12 oz in weight; & she is 3-4 weeks old. She goes back in a few weeks for another check up.

name: Eric “A” Pettway
text: They were very friendly and helpful, will be returning!!!!! They took very good care of all 8 of our saint bernard litter! Thank you LADIES!!

name: Adam Campbell
text: Our family's pets have been patients of MRVC for decades. My wife and I rescued a kitten that showed up at my office at the cold beginning of December. The kitten ended up having no health problems (no worms, etc.) based on the initial exam at MRVC. Despite the kitten's good health, we have been charged $435 by MRVC in the past month to spay and vaccinate this rescue kitten. They made us come back multiple times for the vaccinations of the kitten and charged us an office visit each time. I understand that MRVC has to stay in business but this is absurd, especially when we're trying to save the kitten's life! You try to do something good and get punished for it. This experience really left a bad impression, combined with them charging us $170 to euthanize our old Chihuahua a few months before.

name: blues Miller
text: Dr Hollinger was pleasant and seemingly professional. My problem is l called for an appointment and price, l was told 72 dollars but they tried to get 130 something. The witch at the counter needs some customer skills, she wanted to talk and for me to be quite but l'am not that kind of fella. Just for today l am done with Moffat Rd Vet

name: Jonathan Shearer
text: I had to put my dog down, and the staff here made it as unpleasant as possible. I will keep them in mind for any future veterinary needs.

name: Alice Hamilton

text: They are always accommodating...they give great care to my puppies...I sometimes travel and my puppies are boarded there...thry are always so content going to this office...thry get very good care there..I am very pleased...

name: Dru Scott
text: I would like to Thank Dr. Long and his Saturday staff for their kindness & compasion. I brought my older cat in who had been sick but the night before and had blood coming from his mouth. The person who answered the phone worked him in for an appointment. Dr. Long was very patient before the exam listening to background info. He understood I did not have a lot of money for treatment . After he examined my cat he laid out health concerns,options,and cost. Allowing me to make best decision. After doing so,his staff treated my cat's body with care & dignity without attempting to run up the bill.

text: I just recently switched vets and so glad that I did! The staff is very kind and informative. I was impressed at how quickly we were seen although there was no lack of quality in the service. The vet listened to my concerns and knew exactly what my girl needed. There was no hassle or drawn out process. Great people and decent prices!

name: Laura Owen
text: I decided to come to MRVC when another clinic cancelled our dog’s appointment and I felt he needed to be seen ASAP. MRVC was very nice and allowed me to come last minute. The veterinarian (I’m not sure of her name) was VERY thorough with her concerns for our pet, more than other vets I’ve been to, and made an outstanding effort to care for him and rule out any possibility of other illness. She explained everything very well and gave us the medicine we needed, as well as heart worm prevention and ran additional tests, for an excellent price compared to other places I’ve been. I am very impressed with MRVC and definitely would like to continue bringing our animals there.

name: APRIL JACKSON
text:
We literally got told that The puppy we rescued they q and we’ve been coming for over 10 years told me no they would not. I would not advise anyone to take there animal here anymore I took my other dog out as well. If they truly cared about the animals they would have allowed her to get dewormed. If you don’t want to work on Saturdays should have picked another occupation not just a job.

She mention parvo I’m well aware that with the shot or without they still can die because it happened to us before.

New employees = Horrible Customer Service = Loss of Customers

Please get your old staff back!

name: Jason Pierce
text: Very friendly staff, explained everything well and answered all questions we had about our Boston Terrier's condition and treatment options.  Highly recommend and will be back.

text: It's always nerve wracking going to a new doctor.. it's the same for furbabies.. Thank you for making us feel good about our choice! Dr. Gordon was wonderful as well as all the techs and staff.. they made my spoiled rotten husky and I feel at ease :)

text: Moffett Road veterinary clinic has been my vets for several years now. Recently I lost one of my dogs due to the fact he was 15 years old they were very kind and considerate and understood me crying like a baby as we had to put him to sleep.they allowed me to be with him and watch the process so that I could say goodbye to my fur baby. I would recommend this vet service to everyone.

text: I love these people!  They dont give up when others do. They are affordable and go out of their way to work with you. I consider them all my external family.

name: Dustin Wilson
text:
This morning we put our dog Fry to sleep.  Its one of the hardest things I've ever had to do after bonding with that pup for almost 14 years.

Never an easy thing to do regardless of circumstance, Dr. Long, showed genuine empathy and compassion to our pain.  He was reassuring, kinda, gentle and even seemed emotionally connected to us and Fry Dog Dog.

I don't suppose its easy for the staff to put an animal to sleep any more than it is for the family to say good bye, but there was some feeling of respect for our dog, and respect for our process.

Fry had been seeing Dr Long for a while and they always treated him with love and happiness and he never was scared or upset to go see any of the people at the office.

This is a practice full of kindness, intelligence, and good people who seem to absolutely take pride in what they do.

text: We called to ask about the Medicaid program they participate in, which is where you can get your dog spayed or neutered at a discount price, we were told by Arnold himself they do not participate in it and have nothing like that. I go ahead and pay for the process, take her to get her stitches taken out, and see a sign that says they do offer it. Now they are saying it’s too late because it’s a “process” although it was their fault it happened. We’ve never had a problem with them before, but now we are strongly considering going else where. We may just try Abbie Creek Animal Hospital.

name: Robert Wolff
text: Dr. Karen Lamb and staff are fantastic.  We are so happy that we brought our Boston Terrier Dolly to Dr. Karen today.  It was our first visit and her compassion, gentleness, and attention to detail to ensure she covered all concerns with our Dolly was greatly appreciated.  She took the time to listen, was not pushy, nor quick to diagnose but gave her a thorough exam.  She even got down on the floor to examine her at her level, and to love on her.  Reasonable pricing as well compared to other vets.  We highly recommend Dr. Lamb.  She is now our vet.  Thank you.  Bob and Cathy

name: Computer World
text: Taro loves Dr. Lamb n her staff.

name: Jillian Housch
text: Our pups have received wonderful care from Dr. Karen Lamb (and Laura) since 2008. She is calm, caring, and capable, and has always been understanding about our dog’s anxiety issues.

name: R. Fortner
text: We love Karen Lamb!  She has taken the best and most pragmatic approach to our pets' well being. Even when our big dog passed unexpectedly, she stepped up and helped us with the things our family wanted to do to honor our pup. And very importantly, she has never tried to juice us for extra and unnecessary services or procedures so that she can fund an additional annex to facilities like her equals down the street.  We are never on the defense when going to her. We know she is on our team!!

name: Dawn Davis
text: Karen Lamb discharged me from her practice because her employee didn't order my dogs prescription medication.  I called and ordered it at the beginning of the week, called to check on it and they didn't have it.  I asked if I could get it from another vets office and the employee said Dr. Lamb would call me back.  I was at work when she called me back, yelling at me and saying I was a difficult customer.  I was sitting with other nurses, on my lunch, and they could hear her going off.  I asked them if I was at all mean or nasty when I called the office about the medication and they all said not at all. She discharged me and my dog was out of her medication.  Very irresponsible.  I thought she was a great vet until this happened.

name: Dillie Meeks-Alexander
text: Our little poodle, Summer, had been a patient of Dr Lamb for several years, and Summer always received excellent care from Dr Lamb and her staff.  Summer became very ill, very suddenly last week; unfortunately her health issue was beyond treatment at that point; she had to be put down.  Dr. Lamb was so knowledgeable, kind, caring, sympathetic as was everyone at her practice that afternoon and the days following.  The compassion and comfort we received eased the burden of losing our precious baby.  We highly recommend Dr Lamb and Complete Care for your vet needs.

name: Joy Bard
text: Karen Lamb is, hands down, the best vet I have ever had care for my fur baby.  She's  knowledgeable, direct and above all super down to earth.  Take your pets to her, you won't regret it.

name: Haley *
text: Went here today with our new rescue dog and we were so impressed! The facility is so pretty and clean, the staff was so kind and professional with us and our baby! and Dr. Lamb was amazing! We love complete care and highly recommend this animal hospital!

name: Lorna Light
text: Love Dr. Lamb. She always takes excellent and loving care of all my fur babies.

name: Michael Garrett
text: Wow, best customer service we've ever received, anywhere. Strongly recommend them for any animal care needs.

name: Leslie Dice
text: I took my Sadie to Complete Care with severe dry eye in one eye (due to previous injury) and severe skin allergies that my previous vet has made 0 progress in treating over multiple visits (and hundreds of dollars) over the last year. They were wonderful about scheduling my appointment around my work hours. Dr Lamb was awesome...understanding of my frustration and taking time to explain possible approaches, timelines, hopeful results and alternatives we would try until we find my girl some relief. I'm so ecstatic to say it has only been one week and Sadie's eye is AMAZINGLY improved and we are following a strict diet in hopes that by the time we go back for a follow up, I'll be able to say the same about her skin. I honestly cannot wait to go back and thank Dr Lamb personally!!! I have found a new vet for life!!

name: Chelsea Sowards
text: This clinic is excellent. The entire staff is caring and attentive to the needs of their clients. Every experience leaves me feeling incredibly grateful we found this vet's office!

If you have a real dog, don't bring them here.  They literally called and said they were incapable of handling my Belgian Malinois which is extremely submissive.

All we were asking for was to address his allergies.  What kind of a vet office cannot handle a puppy with allergies?

name: Kevin Dowd
text:
My daughter had to bring a 3 mo old Golden retriever in for a major fracture of his right front paw. First of all the staff was extremely professional, polite, and reassuring. Next, we met with Dr Moore. This man was the best vetinarian I've ever come in contact with in my entire life. Compassion towards the animal, compassion towards my daughter, and an explanation of what needed to be done, what should be done, and the outcome expected. There was no condescension, no rushing to the next client, just pure concern and interest for the patient before him.
I know ppl hate being compared to others, but for those of you who watch the Incredible Dr.Pol, I think this is about as close as it gets as in the style, skill, and compassion displayed by Dr. Moore.
Just a huge thank you to the entire staff for taking care of Shadow, and for putting my daughter at ease.

I even,  no joke, saw a Lemur in the exam room!
If you need a pet Dr I can't say enough good about Walking On The Moon.

name: Paul Johnson
text:
Last year on February 18 Dr. Bufkin did a bi- lateral TPLO surgery on Babygirl. I was unable to bring her in for her final exam at the end of her recovery period because of job relocation. MedVet in Toledo did her final post op exam and I am happy to report that everything healed up perfectly. Today Babygirl is back to 100% . She can do everything she used to be able to do before her injuries. I can't thank Dr. Bufkin and the entire staff at MedVet Mobile enough for taking such good care of Babygirl and for reassuring me that she would be fine. Needless to say I was upset and nervous when I dropped her off for her surgery. However, like I said the staff was very compassionate and reassured me she would be fine. Once again Thank You So Much for getting Babygirl back to 100%. If your pet has an emergency I would highly recommend MedVet Mobile and thier Dr's and staff for such excellent service and pet care.
Thank You Again
Paul Johnson and Babygirl

resp.text: Paul, thank you so much for the kind words about our team, and for entrusting us with Babygirl's care. We're so glad that we were able to be there for you in Mobile, but also once you moved! It's wonderful to hear that Babygirl is back to 100%. We love to hear that great news, and we'll share your positivity with our care team.

text: Absolutely way over priced! They quoted us a price then five minutes later raised the price and ran our card before they did anything. $1800 for a spider bite. No surgery. Just oxygen, steroids and antibiotics. Never again!

text: Paid $140 for the exam (baseline fee for everything) just for the vet to tell me literally nothing without me paying more money for a diagnostic that my pet only had 1 symptom for. Will never use them again, and I highly recommend waiting for another vet appointment unless it is a life or death situation for your pet and there's literally no other options.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We appreciate the feedback and will be sharing it with our hospital leadership team. Rest assured, as pet-lovers ourselves, the health and well-being of pets is always our top priority. Our doctors and hospital team members run tests so they can better understand the issue at hand to help your pet feel better sooner. If you have additional concerns about the care and service your and your pet received, we encourage you to call us or email reviews@medvet.com so we may discuss them. Thank you again for your review.

name: iridescent girl
text: Worst experience I’ve ever had at a vet. all of the bad reviews for this vet are correct. Drive to another city to find another vet. It takes hours for them to see the vet, while your pet is sitting in the back dying. The staff is not friendly. They were asking how much money I had to spend to treat my animal accordingly... honestly a very unprofessional way to go about things.. and multiple times of brining up money definitely helped paint the picture of their intentions in their practice. My dog was poisoned and they didn’t treat her for 3 hours after getting her that they couldn’t get all the fluid in her because she was losing the ability to swallow. She’s yelping in pain and in the no better condition than when I brought her in. I wish I would of drove to another city or state because the wait time would of been the same. Almost $700 gone just to get some fluids and anti-nausea medicine in her system, nothing more. Listen to the reviews, do not go here. And Medvet, do not reply to this review with your copy and paste message, there is nothing you can do to improve the terrible experience you’ve give me and so many people, and your poor service is letting animals suffer.

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. We'd like to look into your situation more. If you would like to speak with someone about your experience, please contact the hospital direct and ask to speak with a member of the leadership team. We will be sharing your feedback with them.

text:
very bad place
This place is the worst!!! I wouldn't recommend it to no one. I took my dog here because it was the only place open after hours. They would not let me go inside with my dog due to covid (which is understandable). My husband and myself sat in the parking lot and had to wait for them to call us. When they called, which was 2 hours later, they told us they needed to run a few test and take blood and it would be $1200.00. We told them no just to bring us our dog. A lady came out the door without our dog and said we owed $134.00 for their services. We asked what service that had not did anything. She said because the dr called us and said he wanted to run test. She refused to bring us our dog until we paid the 134.00. So we paid 134.00 for the vet to call us and say he wanted to run test....very unbelievable and sad !!

text: My local vet sent us to MedVet when my Chorkie was hit by a car on Thanksgiving morning. We called on our way because we knew her condition was critical. They took our information as we traveled to Mobile. They kept us informed as they assessed her and as they communicated with a surgeon in New Orleans. Ultimately it was decided there was nothing that could be done for her and she was euthanized. The nurse that called to go over the paperwork with us cried with us as she read it. They brought Pippa Grace out so we could be with her and say our goodbyes. The entire staff was so kind and compassionate during the entire process. About two weeks after her passing, we received a sympathy card signed by the entire staff. They are amazing and go above and beyond.

resp.text: Thank you, Jenn, for the kind words about our team. We are sorry for the loss of your sweet Pippa Grace.
