name: David Rains
text: I had to select one star to leave a review,I don't think they even deserve one star. After being charged $130 to walk in the door we were charged $310 for a parvo test, that then leaves $300+ for a couple shots bringing the bill to $700+,the parvo test results were negative they said. That's when they wanted to know how we were going to pay. Because my friend didn't have $700 on her,they acted like they were doing her a favor by charging half making the bill $350,I had to pay some of that for her to get her dog back and then they discontinued services for the dog. It turns out that the dog did have parvo and died because she didn't have money to see another vet in time. I called a vet that I have used in the past and she told me her office visit was $20. And a parvo test was $39.00. I just want them to know that they didn't do anyone any favors by taking this woman's money for a misdiagnosis and refusing to treat the dog. It was a terrible experience and I hope they change their was.

resp.text: David, thank you for sharing your feedback. I am so sorry for the loss of your friend's dog. I also apologize that the experience at MedVet did not feel as caring and supportive as I know our healthcare team aspires for it to be. I know our hospital team would be willing to speak with your friend about her experience. She can contact the hospital direct or email reveiws@medvet.com.

name: Good Citizen (Good Citizen)
text: Our dog got into an altercation with another dog and lost her eye during the night of hurricane Zeta. Luckily, Medvet was open and provided her with immediate care. The staff was very caring and compassionate and kept us updated several times after the surgery. They provided excellent care to our Mitzy. Highly recommend this place!!!!!!

resp.text: We are so happy to hear that Mitzy continues to do well and that we were able to provide her with the care she needed. She's such a great dog, and it was our pleasure to care for her. Thank you for your kind review.

name: Gabe McClellan
text: my Cat had a miscarriage for her first litter and had trouble passing them through, took her up there just yesterday and was told given 2-3 days she would pass them no problem and be back to normal, sounded kinda funny to me at first I don’t understand how a 12 pound cat can handle being in labor for 3 days but I took their word for it, and my cat passed away tonight, will never come back here could’ve been so easily prevented.

resp.text: Gabe, I am so sorry for the loss of your beloved cat. I also apologize that your experience at MedVet did not feel as caring and supportive as I know our healthcare team aspires for it to be. It sounds like we could learn a lot by talking with you more specifically about the experience. If you would like to discuss the care, please contact the hospital direct and ask to speak with a member of the leadership team. The other option is for you to email us at reveiws@medvet.com. Thank you again for taking the time to share your feedback.

name: Amanda Allgood
text: I have never written a negative review of any business before but I felt compelled to share our experience at Med Vet in Mobile, which was an extremely negative one. Two weeks ago, our 12 year old Maltese suddenly could not walk on his hind legs. Due to it being a weekend, we could not reach our vet and our neighbor, who is also a vet, was out of town but we were able to speak to him and he warned us it was probably a slipped disc which would require prednisone and crate rest for several weeks. Several people recommended taking him to Med Vet, which we did so promptly and the acting vet, Dr. Rehm, did diagnose him with slipped disc and said he was a candidate for surgery. She wanted to keep him at the facility until Monday when the surgeon would be in and wanted to administer IV fluids, wanted him to have a colostomy bag, etc. We were just not comfortable with this seemingly very aggressive treatment (especially when our neighbor had told us he would probably just need meds and rest) before speaking to our dog's vet he has seen his whole life and who we trust and having him examine him personally. When I told Dr. Rehm we weren't comfortable with keeping him there overnight and especially with surgery, she told me that "euthanasia would be a reasonable option." I immediately told my husband who was the one that took our dog to Med Vet and was waiting in the parking lot due to Covid restrictions  (I was home with our young children) to get him out of that place immediately. The nurse tried to persuade him to keep him there and quoted a price of $1500 for the 2 day stay until Monday when the surgeon could look at him (not for the surgery itself, mandatory MRI before surgery, etc - that would all be additional). When my husband asked her to just give him medicine and prepare him to be taken home that night, she asked "what were we willing to pay?" which did not sit well with us at all and made it seem like, to them, everything was about how much money they could make off of our dog. The cost was absolutely not a factor for us. We were simply not comfortable with the facility, the treatment, and especially the acting vet, who had been so callous. I am so glad we took him home with us that night. We followed up with our personal vet and after crate rest for 2 weeks (which we will continue for another few weeks), our sweet pup is walking normally. He never lost the ability to eat, drink, urinate, or defecate independently and honestly never acted like he was even in pain. I feel like Med Vet tried to take complete advantage of our situation and our beloved pet and we could have potentially spent thousands of dollars unnecessarily if we had not followed our intuition and taken him from this facility as quickly as possible. If you are looking for a compassionate vet, conservative treatment unless absolutely warranted, and professionals who care about your pet and your family, I would absolutely not recommend Med Vet in Mobile under any circumstance.

resp.text: Hi, Amanda. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. Your feedback has been passed along to the hospital leadership team. I apologize that the communication you received did not feel as compassionate and caring as our team aspires to be. If you would like to speak with someone more about this, you can call the hospital or email reviews@medvet.com. Thank you again for your feedback, and we are glad to hear that your dog is doing better.

name: Jay Carter
text: They know how to take advantage of monopolistic weekends when they know your fur baby ain't going anywhere else,.. $ch-ching!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. I'm sorry you feel that our prices are too high. We pride ourselves on leading specialty care for pets and on providing the best and most compassionate care. Just as is the case in human healthcare, specialty expertise comes at a price that is driven by the years of academic training and experience of our team. As pet lovers ourselves, we do our best to keep our prices affordable and reasonable. Recognizing that each client has unique circumstances, we do offer special financing options through CareCredit. We will share your feedback with our hospital leadership. Thanks again for sharing it with us.

name: Toni Tyson
text: The doctors, nurses, and staff are amazing. They kept me updated on how my furbaby was doing and was ok with me constantly calling for updates. I love them.

resp.text:
Hi Toni!
We are so happy we could be there when you needed us!

name: Patty Bailey
text: I have taken 3 fur babies here for various energency issues. Although they are always super busy, they take the time to give care to your pet as quickly as possible and give consistent updates. They are professional and have a friendly staff and give great service. They really care about your pet's needs and care about their well being. I will always use them when I cannot get in to see our regular vet during business hours. Amazing vet office!

resp.text:
Hi Patty,
Thank you for your kind words. I will be sure to pass them on to our entire team. If there's anything else you may need, please let us know!

name: Fred Nurk
text: Dr Martin was patient and kind with my mother who's cat was injured.  He and the team gave great advice and dealt with her grief well.  The cat ended up healthy and happy.

resp.text:
Hi Fred,
Thank you for letting us know about your recent visit. I will be sure to let Dr. Maertens know of your kind words. We're so happy your mother's cat is doing well! The team will love hearing that. If there's anything else we can do, please let us know!

name: Elizabeth Alvarez
text: Very over priced!! They will say the fee is $130 and then add another $40 for “nursing care” so really the upfront fee is $170. They have strong opinions on how you should care for your dog and make sure you know you’re being judged for whatever happened that was out of your control. They took almost 2 hours just to tell us what they wanted to do in the mean time did nothing to help him besides stick him in a cage. I will never take another pet here even if they are dying.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We appreciate the feedback and will be sharing it with our hospital leadership team. Rest assured, as pet-lovers ourselves, the health and well-being of pets is always our top priority. Our doctors and hospital team members run tests so they can better understand the issue at hand to help your pet feel better sooner. If you have additional concerns about the care and service your and your pet received, we encourage you to call us or email reviews@medvet.com so we may discuss them. Thank you again for your review.

name: Juan Pardo
text: I never write reviews but I had to after visiting MedVet. These people are AWESOME! We took a stray kitten who had a seizure and they did a great job and were up front/honest with everything. Don't listen to the bad reviews.

resp.text:
Hi Juan,
Thanks for your wonderful review. We're so glad we could be there to help the stray kitten you found. Thank you for being a good samaritan, too! If there's anything else you need from us, please let us know.

name: Amy Johnson
text: Don't read into the bad reviews on this place! I was expecting the worse and being charged a lot! These people really do care about animals and are reasonably priced!!! They required a deposit which I got money back, honestly they can keep the extra 50.00. The staff over the phone and the gal that came and got my fur baby was nothing but kind and professional and kept me in the loop.  From Ravana and I warm hug and a huge thank you!

resp.text: Hi Amy! Thank you for your kind recommendation. We know you have a choice of where to bring your pet for specialty care, and it means a lot to our team that you chose MedVet. We are so happy Ravana is doing well!

name: Jason Clark
text: Let’s see first off it’s messed up that none of the vets anywhere will help an animal if the owner can’t afford care so now my animal is going die thanks for nothing hope all that money brings you happiness

resp.text:
Hi Jason,
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. I'm sorry you feel that our prices are too high. We pride ourselves on leading specialty care for pets and on providing the best and most compassionate care. Just as is the case in human healthcare, specialty expertise comes at a price that is driven by the years of academic training and experience of our team. As pet lovers ourselves, we do our best to keep our prices affordable and reasonable. Recognizing that each client has unique circumstances, we do offer special financing options through CareCredit. We will share your feedback with our hospital leadership. Thanks again for sharing it with us.

name: James Wiley
text: Dr. Bufkin provided expert, professional care for our dog and the team was very responsive and helpful in keeping us informed during his surgery and hospitalization.  Glad to have these specialists in Mobile.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review. Like you, our healthcare team members love animals and it was our pleasure to be there for you. I will be sure to let Dr. Bufkin know of your compliments.

name: Marianne Smith
text:
I can’t explain how grateful we are to have this Emergency Vet in our community. My family found my 2 year old dog in our back yard collapsed with tongue out and about an hour from a very painful death. We rushed him to the Med Vet clinic.  We called on the way to let them know the situation. He was barely hanging on. We didn’t know if he got bit or what happened. They were super professional and let me know up front the Initial expense without knowing if he’d make it or how long he’d be there. They did their best.
Our dog ended up having Addison’s disease where they collapse in a crisis state. They went above and beyond to diagnose, treat and save little McDuff’s life. I couldn’t be happier with a job well done by all who touch my baby. I would like to say please be a little easier on these guys. They do the best they can. They have to ask up front about money because in a tragic situation many people just expect service. They come in frantically needing help. I would imagine they are like everyone else and can’t run a business off of charity even though every one of them would if they could. They are really caring Doctors and staff, it really is an emergency situation facility.Big Shout out to B for being his buddy, cleaning him when he didn’t have his dignity. LoL....Elissa for giving me the most caring updates and loving on him,Dr.life for being awesome and explaining his condition so well and caring for him all those nights,Dr.Rehm I absolutely believe this girl is a great asset to your team. She saved his life by diagnosing him quickly, effectively and thankfully for us she not only listened in med school But had experienced this condition and could read the signs. This is somewhat difficult to catch. She was spot on! There was another Dr. a man who I can’t remember his name.thank you to all of you!!!!
Thank you all for giving each animal a second chance. McDuff loves y’all! From the Flowers Family!

resp.text:
Hi Marianne,

What a wonderful review! Thank you so much for taking time to let us know about your recent experience with us. We're so glad our team was there to help you and McDuff! I will be sure to let Elissa, Dr. Life, Dr. Rehm, and our entire team know of your compliments. If there's anything else you may need, please let us know!

name: Michele Anderson
text: GREAT TEAM ! I just had the best experience EVER at this Mobile vet office.The entire staff was welcoming, kind and very informative from Cecelia at front door to the doctor and assistant. Great care and very reasonable. My cat and I are HAPPY and he had the best care ever! THANK YOU 👍

name: Sierra p
text: My dog hunter was diagnosed with cancer and needed a specialist to remove it from his nose. I went in for an appointment to talk about the plan for my dog. I have worked in the animal field for many years and I was so impressed with all of the staff. The front staff are on the ball they knew who my dog was and me. The techs were very smart and answered all of my questions with no hesitations. The doctor is very talented and treated hunter with care. For something that was very scary for our family all of the staff made us feel so good. Not to mention I called to check on him alot and they never cared they were so nice that to me was so important. Oh and hunter was always happy to see the staff . Wonderful people who need more credit then they have gotten. Specialist and 24/7 hospital will always be a little costly but you have trained staff that you can trust your pet with and that's all that matters.

name: Kathy Garraway
text: I’d also give a zero if available. MedVet was my dog’s on call Vet. My dog acutely could not stand on 2 legs. She also had a fungal infection . They did nothing. Never checked her legs, advised arthritis medication and something for itching. They were out of any meds for fungal infect... all fungal infections.!! I took my dog back and left. I’ll never go back there. Beware.

name: Jackie Thebaud
text: The vet and staff here are professional and very compassionate. We had to bring our elderly dog in for euthanasia over a holiday weekend when our regular vet was not available. Their kindness was very comforting in a sad situation.

name: Lee Ann Camp
text: Super nice, caring, and developed a great system for our safety during coronavirus crisis.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we navigate the current COVID situation together. I will be sure to pass on your kind words to our entire team.

name: Jay Wms
text: This place is not for low income people. If you have a animal in need of service they rather your baby die before seeing them due to MONEY. My baby is a 6wk old puppy & was ran over by a truck & needed assistance. I informed them of this info before bringing him out & when i got there i was told it will be $130 for office visit & $200+ for X-Ray & other stuff. This wasn't an issue, i just didn't have it all @ once. I am happy to do a payment plan or something so I was told to do Care Credit & was denied so my baby still laying around slowing dying & in pain. Money is all they care about the animals means NOTHING to them!!

name: jennifer chinners
text: My sister had to have her dog treated at med vet and they are the kindest, best vet.

resp.text: Hi Jennifer, thanks so much for your kind words. I'll be sure to pass them on to our team.

name: Billy Harrington
text: Had to take my daughter's dog here since family vet was closed. By far worst place I've ever been will never go back . charged me 700.00 and literly did not but give my dog antibiotics..😡

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. I'm sorry you feel that our prices are too high. We pride ourselves on leading specialty care for pets and on providing the best and most compassionate care. Just as is the case in human healthcare, specialty expertise comes at a price that is driven by the years of academic training and experience of our team. As pet lovers ourselves, we do our best to keep our prices affordable and reasonable. Recognizing that each client has unique circumstances, we do offer special financing options through CareCredit. We will share your feedback with our hospital leadership. Thanks again for sharing it with us.

name: Merideth Landry
text: Really sad that this is the only emergency vet in our area. All they care about is money.  So strange to me how a vets office can be so unsympathetic.  No bedside manner.  They are in the wrong profession if all they want is money.  They definitely dont care for the animals-- it's just another day at the office for them. I would avoid this place if  at all possible!! You will thank yourself later. I have PTSD from this place.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We are sorry that you feel our prices are too high. We pride ourselves on leading specialty healthcare for pets and providing the best and most compassionate care. As pet-lovers ourselves, we do our best to keep our prices affordable and reasonable. Recognizing each client has unique circumstances, we also offer special financing options through CareCredit. We will share your feedback with our hospital leadership team. Again, we appreciate your feedback and thank you for sharing it with us.

name: Gulf Coast Cleanup
text: God bless Dr. Zimlich and his wonderful staff. These are essential workers through this dangerous time and they are our heros. We were treated with love and compassion as they treated our 15 year old furbaby. Dr. Zimlich, you showed us Christ's love while we were in a crisis. You've earned a jewel in your crown and our forever loyalty! Thank you for being you!

name: Andrew Millar
text: Refused service for my pet because I dont have the money just get the apply for a care credit card "sorry you are broke/unemployed" thanks for nothing plus looking through the reviews seems that's all the employees and staff does is post fake reviews to boost the ratings

name: Teddy Busby
text: Dr. Skinas was so good at explaining things and establishing a plan of care. The DC instructions were very detailed; I was comfortable with how to manage at home.

name: Daniel Pennington
text: The amazing people that work here helped me so much with the passing of my cat Otter. They were genuine, kind and compassionate in my time of need. They quickly went to work on him as soon as we brought him in on a Sunday but unfortunately there was nothing they could do to save him. I will always be thankful for Dr. Life, Hayley at reception and the rest of this amazing team at MedVet.

name: Marena Truitt
text: The veterinarian was so kind and compassionate. The staff understood my concern about my puppy and were very diligent in caring for him. I am so glad this place is available in my city!

name: Katherine Dixon
text: The staff took the time to take my phone call, give amazing information, and lead me to to make the right choices for our kitten (who is doing great). Thank you doesn't even seem adequate, BUT thank you!!

name: Brandon Silvia
text: The entire staff were some of the most genuinely kind, caring & compassionate people. Each member worked along side the next to make sure every animal was treated adequately in a timely manner. Would recommend this location to anyone and everyone who may need their services.

name: Jason Strickland
text: Amazing staff, nurses and doctors. They took great care of our chihuahua Daisy Mae in he left most critical time. They are compassionate, eager to answer any qeustion we had and just phenomenal. We feel she received the best care that put her on the road to recovery. We can’t thank them enough for all they did to help our sweet Daisy Mae.

name: kayla slone
text: This place is the WORST. Try George county vet in Lucedale Ms. This ?medvet place tried to charge 500$ JUST for x-rays and exam not the total!! Couldn't imagine what it woildve been after any stitches or cast. While George county charged 235$ TOTAL!!

name: Sara Sims
text: I went into this vet tonight in tears because my puppy all of a sudden fell ill. They would not even see my pup without a $130 upfront charge. After I told them I didn’t have the money right then they offered to let me apply for care credit.. when I was denied they came in the room and told me there was nothing they could do To save my puppy because I didn’t have enough money. My puppy most definitely has a twisted stomach and the only thing that will save her is an emergency visit to the vet and emergency surgery. These people turned me and my dying puppy away over $130. Now as I write this I am sitting here watching my puppy die, in pain. These people have absolutely no compassion for people or animals. I am furious and devastated.

name: Chris Brown
text: I just want to say this place is very unprofessional. They have no clue about animals and while you wait 8 hours on a non busy day in the lobby. They like to laugh and joke with each other while your dying dog is in the back room that you can’t see. The vet Lauren was nice but was stumped as to what was wrong with my paralyzed dog. So no broken bones as she did an X-ray $500.00 and referred me to a neurologist. they pushed me out the door practically with no clue of what was going to happen.  told me to push on her stomach to help her pee and didn’t even try to explain or describe the ordeal. Now my dog is dead with blood coming out of her rear end. Not only do I feel robbed angry with these money hungry people but sad that there was little to no help with what I was told to be the best vet to go to.

name: Dana Cook
text: The staff helped us add soon as s we walked in and gave us regular updates. They were ahi nice to my family, my pup, and myself. The only reason I give a 4 is because of the cost, but our pets are priceless.

name: Jennifer Henderson
text: NEVER AGAIN!!!! THIS PLACE IS A JOKE!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with your experience, Jennifer. We would really like to look further into these issues you've had. Can you provide us with your pet's name and contact information so our Hospital Director can reach out to you directly?  As an alternative, you can also email reviews@medvet.com. Thank you and we look forward to connecting with you.

name: Deena Copeland
text: Compassionate staff - private room (not exam setting room) provided for those that have to say goodbye to their loved one.  Excellent staff - sensitive to families needs.

name: Faith Jones
text: We went in at around 4 in the morning. Our 2 week old puppy was not feeling well😔 I was tired and exhausted with staying up with Twixx. We have feed her from birth. Something was wrong and my daughter and I was really scared. The staff and vet was so sweet and understanding of our concerns.  Explained and answered our questions.  We are really thankful for this place and the staff. Never stop caring! Be blessed! Twice has bee doing good! 2 more days and we will be at the 3 week old mark!! Blessed! Love our fur babies! Thank you front the bottom of our hearts!!

name: Nicole
text: Nice staff. Good DVM. Kind of costly - charges 104$ examination fee to be seen + additional medication/procedure costs.

name: Good Vibes
text: My Daisy Mae was treated by the amazing staff at this facility. They were patient with all my calls no matter how many times or the time of night I called to check on my dog. They were very thorough with me even though they had such a busy load at the time we were there. The doctor didn’t once try to rush me and truly cared. They offered much comfort to me when I needed it most and were just so compassionate. I cannot thank them enough for treating my baby like their own and helping her begin her healing process.

name: Stephen Wilkerson
text: Our 6-year old Dachshund was expecting puppies and her delivery was anticipated for this past Thursday/Friday. She began to exhibit labor symptoms and eventually her water broke. After several hours of watching her and taking her on short walks we were not seeing any puppies. She did not appear to be in distress but was obviously tired and acted as though her labor was stopping. Our vet referred us here and we arrived around midnight on Friday. The staff was very friendly and caring and presented us with options for X-ray/Ultrasounds to check status/health of unborn puppies and then go from there. The tests identified a problem with the pup in birth canal and suggested c-section to get pups out. We left her in their care to prep for surgery etc. The doctor and staff kept us posted over the next 4 very long hours and we received good news that Momma came through surgery fine with two healthy male pups. We were very sad that the pup in birth canal did not make it along with a smaller female. But considering the urgency of the situation and the quick and thorough response from the MedVet team, we focused on the very positive (Momma with two boys) and able to bring them home a couple hours later. They are all doing very well and Momma loves and cares for her two sweet boys. It certainly was not an inexpensive experience but no surprises as the team relayed estimated costs (low to high) along the way and we were right in the middle. And Google search confirmed the costs to be fair and reasonable when compared to other emergency vets (especially for a Fri midnight). Thank You MedVet in Mobile for saving our Momma and pups and for treating us with extra care cause we were borderline crazy dog people in distress! 💙💙

name: Adam Sandy
text: Everyone from the front desk staff to the vet was very kind and compassionate towards us and our 🐈. While we did have to wait 30m to be seen, this is to be expected as they are the only place open in Mobile for pet's at midnight. Just like a regular ER, some situations take precedence over other's so depending on your animals situation, you might have to wait depending on what other animals are here and their problems. I like the fact that once they call you from the lobby, they have private waiting rooms with couches for you and your pet to relax in. The vet came up with a plan of attack and took into consideration the cost of everything and did them one at a time as to not do any unnecessary costly procedures/testing. Would highly recommend this place, their services are cheaper than my regular vet has charged in the past and I felt like they actually care about my pets health after I left the facility.

name: Juniper Harp
text: Our dog was hit by a car and passed away. Not sure what to do about his remains, we called a few places before calling MedVet. They explained all of the options to me over the phone clearly and calmly while I was panicking, and we were able to bring his body in for them to send off to their third party cremation center. My husband and I arrived very distraught, and the two ladies who met us were calm and sympathetic, and showed us to a private room where we could cry and fill out paperwork. They were just the help we needed on one of the worst nights of our life, and we will be bringing our other dog there if we need an emergency clinic.

name: Ema Rayne
text: Dr. Lackey and her team went absolutely above and beyond for my furbaby. She was kind and informative, explaining what was going on with my cat, his medications and what they were going to be doing to him. The facility was extremely clean. The team was also wonderful and sweet, answering all of our questions. They treated Jeff with care as well as eased all of our worries. They worked with us as we were on a budget and it was an emergency visit. I would highly reccomend this clinic and Dr. Lackey

name: Crystal Pettway
text: I'd give ZERO stars if it was possible. Someone please investigate these people for cruelty.

name: elaine kittrell
text: The most advanced and best equipped vet that I have ever seen. Very knowledgeable staff. Speaking of the Metairie, LA facility. The Mobile location is an extension of a larger network of Medvet offices and the only 24/7/365 emergency vet in the area.

name: Bethany Reid
text: The nurses and doctor here are very nice, they were comforting when I had to euthanize my cat. Amidst me sobbing I felt truly like the nurse at the front desk really cared. It's an emergency 24/7 vet care center so I won't complain about the prices. It is expensive but worth the good care you get.

name: Lorraine Nalley
text: I had an emergency with my dog, Dante, last night. Dante was taken in and treated quickly. I had a long wait to talk to the doctor but, they had some serious cases last night and she got with me as soon as she could. Dr. Life was knowledgeable  and kind. We made the decision to have Dante put down and it was so peaceful. I had always dreaded the day I would have to put him down but, I am so glad Dr. Life was the one to do it. She explained everything to me and did the procedure with Dante on my lap, petting him and telling him how much I  loved him. It was a hard situation to be in but, Dr. Life made it a lot easier on me. Everyone at the clinic showed me kindness and courtesy.

name: Caroline McConathy
text:
I am ONLY giving one star because our dog is still alive.
That being said...although the vet saved our dog’s life from eating a foreign object using emergency surgery...we had to wait over 4 hours to even be seen while our dog was in pain.  He did not even go into surgery until 5-6 hours from our arrival.
We were referred to Medvet from our regular vet bc they did and X-ray and said our dog could  have a less invasive endoscopic procedure if we went to MedVet.
Well...We couldn’t have that procedure anymore by the time they finally saw our dog. At that point, it had traveled beyond the stomach to small bowel...it’s possible that if our dog had been seen in a timely manner for an emergency clinic, it might have have been retrieved via scope.
It was $2400 for these services. They also misquoted us on price and charged us an additional $300 when we went to pick our dog up.
Then our dog ended up with an infection we had to have treated by our veterinarian, which cost us an additional $400.00.
I shutter to think what would happen if you had a time sensitive emergency such as a car accident...
I do not recommend MedVet unless you literally have no other option.

name: Melissa Ragan
text: The staff were all very friendly. Everyone treated me and my dogs with kindness and respect. Though I was there for an emergency and was a little anxious, everyone was calm and professional which made me more calm. I love my primary veterinarian but I was very pleased with my experience here.

name: Tell Tale
text:
Came here from Pensacola. Pensalcola told us it would be 6000 minimum to operate on our pup, due to an obstruction, even though no tests were done other than one vet feeling  her tummy, and a second vet also feeling her tummy mentioning she couldn't feel it. Still we were told we had to pay 6000 to have her operated on immediately otherwise she would die soon. They wouldn't  even stabilize her until we could get the funds together, and 6000 was way more than we could afford.

Called this place, drove to the next state to take her to be told exactly what we were thinking... our pup should have xrays and blood work before any kind of surgery. The vet said she didn't seem critical, and that it's most likely worms or parvo, and he spent a lot more time examining her than Pensacola did.

Anyway, they have our pup, and are testing her like a vet should for 1600, as well as keeping her for a couple of days

Thank the lord. We prayed and prayed for help. And the lord has come through. The guy who is taking care of her is amazing. It's worth driving out of state here for treatment from a vet who isn't  trying to scam and uses common sense before cutting puppies open.

Thank you. This place needs a lot more credit than is given!!!

name: M R
text: Stay away from Dr. Maertens! His lack of empathy, experience and knowledge shows in his every word. No one returns calls or seems to know what is going on with patients.

name: nicole Ward
text: I sit in their exam room writing this review because we are so mad. I have wanted over and hour and a half just for someone to take my cat out of the exam room and take her vitals. Which really means they just took my cat out the exam room and set her somewhere else so I would think they are doing something. not only that you will be charged 95 dollars for an exam, just the exam, you dont get to see the exam so who knows if they actually did it. needless to say if you enjoy waiting for hours with your sick animal for the doc to see you this is what you will get here. Please do not come here.

name: J P
text: Dr Bufkin at MedVet is amazing.  He will sit down and talk with you, not at you.  He is compassionate and very knowledgeable.  Our girl had a extremely rare muscle disease(she was the third ever case in history).  He helped us get a extra 2 months with her that we would not have had otherwise.  Ultimately her battle was lost.  However we are extremely appreciative of those last two months we did get with our love.

name: paul putchinski
text: Out of town and called with a sick guinea pig, told "sorry the vet on staff today does not see pigs"  nurse seemed genuinely sorry after hearing the story...pig died later that day.  This was the only recommendation (and place open) we could find on Thanksgiving.  Stinks to watch your 11 year old do every thing she can to keep that animal alive with no veterinary training and only Google to try and do what we could...

name: Jessica Marlin
text: Do not take your dog or any animal here because they charged for our dog and they had to known he was going to die without the medicine that could had saved his life.  They failed to give the medicine to him until the next morning when he should had taken it as soon as he arrived.  I think they didn't have the medicine and they waited until the next morning to get it but acted as if they had it and that he didn't need it until 12 hours later. Trust me when I say the dog needed the medicine, it was very obvious.    I repeat DO NOT take your dog here.  There are other emergency vets in Mobile like Theodore Vet where the technology is impeccable and service outstanding.  Also Rehm animal clinic is open at night.  Take your furry family member to a more professional and seasoned establishment. If I could rate a zero I would but I cannot.  God bless!

name: Nichol Thornton
text:
I was no where NEAR impressed with this facility. For an emergency vet I was disgusted by the lack of compassion these people show. Its deplorable! I would recommend driving to an emergency vet in Florida or Mississippi before utilizing their services again.

It wasn't even that the price was unreal - its an emergency vet that's expected and I don't care my pets are family but the deplorable attitudes need to be adjusted for the price people pay.

name: Star Amelotte
text: DO NOT take your animals to MedVet. They happen to be the on call people for our regular vet. 5 hours and $740 later to tell us our dog just has an upset stomach.  I dont mind spending money to get our animals the proper care, but this place is just a money racket. We witnessed a dog come in with something stuck in her mouth. A nurse came in and was able to get it right out before the people filled out any paperwork or were checked in. Well another nurse came in right after and realized what happened, as they were going back to the back she mumbled "you just cost us $750" Not to mention, they do not offer payment plans. If you cant pay for everything up front, then your animal wont be treated at all. Screw this place.

name: Erin Putnam
text: I read a couple bad reviews, so was a tad nervous to bring our cat, however we needed emergency services and didn't have another option. We did not have the outcome we desired, as we had to put our cat down (due to being hit by a car), however all of the staff were very caring, courteous, and professional. Prices are higher than our usual vet, but they are 24-h clinic, so that was expected. I would use them again and recommend to others.

name: LucieLoo
text: Amazing staff, very knowledgeable and professional. The whole staff was very sweet and concerned about my kitty. I was very impressed and I would highly recommend them 😊

name: Dwanda Schwarz
text:
We had a neighbor stray cat that we seen on our street 3 or 4 times. The poor guy fell out of a tree and got himself wedged in branches below where he remained stuck overnight until found. By time neighbors had split the tree apart with rope and a truck to free the cat, he was found to have paralyzed himself during the fall from waist section down after breaking his little back. All the neighbor kids and adults were broken hearted for this little guy. We couldnt let him suffer outdoors without the ability to walk. My fiance and I ran him on a sunday to MedVet to have him Euthanized.
We were very distraught seeing the poor guy in so much pain and suffering. But MedVet was empathetic and loving to this little kitty we named Jack just before his departure.
The procedure was fast and painless for poor little Jack. We really appreciated having MEDVET during this time and will go back if we ever need help for a furry friend in the future!

name: Bethany Walker
text: I had a kitten who got very sick, well when I first noticed him getting sick, I called the vet to ask for opinions and all the lady told me was to bring him in and it would be $94 just so the doctor would see him. I didn't take him right away due to work, but I ended up taking him later that night when he got worst because it was the weekend and I didn't have anywhere else to take him. Everyone that worked there was so rude. They were all about the money. They ended up telling me that it was going to be $1500 just to find out what was wrong with my kitten and all that they could do was stabilize him for the time being and that I would eventually have to euthanize him. I chose to have him put down because he was in so much pain, and I stayed in the room with him while they did it. The doctor who gave him his shots didn't even seem to care. It was just another paycheck to him. I don't care about them being rude or not being sympathetic, what makes me most mad about this experience is that they didn't even seem to want to help my kitten. they couldn't tell me whether or not he was going to make it, just that it was going to be $1500 to find out. If I would have gone anywhere else, I would know what happened to my kitten and he would probably be here today. I will never use this vet again.

resp.text: Thank you Bethany for taking the time to review our hospital. We are very sorry that your visit with us did not meet your expectations. Client experience is very important to us and we appreciate you letting us know that there are opportunities for improvement. . If you would like to contact us regarding your visit, please email reviews@medvetforpets.com

name: Prima Plauche
text: We received prompt and professional vet services for our senior Afghan Hound on a holiday weekend. It is comforting to know that we have a quality emergency vet clinic that is open 24/7.

name: Christopher Clark
text: Friendly place, was great with my dog

name: Michelle Thornton
text: Had to select 1 star to leave my review this place is nothing but a money racket completely misdiagnosed my dog and cost my whole check.

name: Anida Viravong
text: Read bad reviews but had no choice but to bring my puppy. Estimated time was 1-2 hours. However, wait was not even an hour. Excellent customer service and they deserve more credibility.

name: Dwanda Schwarz
text:
We had a neighbor stray cat that we seen on our street 3 or 4 times. The poor guy fell out of a tree and got himself wedged in branches below where he remained stuck overnight until found. By time neighbors had split the tree apart with rope and a truck to free the cat, he was found to have paralyzed himself during the fall from waist section down after breaking his little back. All the neighbor kids and adults were broken hearted for this little guy. We couldnt let him suffer outdoors without the ability to walk. My fiance and I ran him on a sunday to MedVet to have him Euthanized.
We were very distraught seeing the poor guy in so much pain and suffering. But MedVet was empathetic and loving to this little kitty we named Jack just before his departure.
The procedure was fast and painless for poor little Jack. We really appreciated having MEDVET during this time and will go back if we ever need help for a furry friend in the future!

name: Christopher Clark
text: Friendly place, was great with my dog

text: Had to select 1 star to leave my review this place is nothing but a money racket completely misdiagnosed my dog and cost my whole check.

name: Peggy Krebs
text: Dr. Brian Bufkin, at the MedVet location in Mobile AL, is undoubtably the most knowledgeable, professional, detailed Doctor I have ever encountered. He explained step by step the details of a suspected mast tumor, that Spanky may have, and steps to be taken.He is board certified, and I suggest that you google him. As a client, I have never experienced such professionalism, knowledgeable, and comforting doctor for animals. I left having complete trust in Dr.Bufkin, and I feel assured with any decision he makes, for Spanky. Trisha, who is part of the staff, was very detailed, knowledgeable and professional leaving me assured that I could call 24/7 with any questions or concerns. We love our babies like family, and you can leave them in their hands, knowing, they will have the best care possible. THANK YOU!!

name: Adeva Wilson
text: Dr.Zimlich is excellent! Thank you so much for taking great care of my Lab.

name: Potato Basket
text: My dog injured his elbow and was in too much pain to walk. I was referred by the family vet to the orthopedic surgeon at MedVet. After a consultation it was decided that my dog needed surgery. Dr. Bufkin took the time to explain and show me what exactly was wrong with my dog's elbow as well as what would be performed during the surgery to repair his injury. Needless to say that taking care of a big dog after any surgery isn't a fun task but the staff at MedVet provided me with plenty of instructions beforehand to ensure that his recovery and healing period would progress smoothly. They were always available to answer any questions I had throughout the process. I am very happy to say that my dog is all healed now and is back 100% with full mobility, running and playing just as he always did. You wouldn't even know that he ever had such a painful injury a few months ago.

name: Jon F
text:
Our 8 year old dog started to not eat her food and we noticed a bulge in her side. Our normal vet checked out our dog and had a feeling her issues were probably a cancerous spleen given the hard lumps location. We didn’t want to wait for a closer surgeon to come back from vacation so we went to MedVet. Dr Bufkin was very knowledgeable about dog cancers and the options available. He knows his dog cancers and sat and talked with us quite a while. I felt much better about leaving her there after talking with him. After reviewing her info and checking her out on an quick ultrasound he agreed with our vet that our dog maybe had a few months if surgical procedures went well and we got chemo. But could be as short as a few weeks or possibly not even a successful surgery due to how large the spleen was and standard surgery risks. He was very helpful though and explained the risks and different types of cancers it could be. We decided to do surgery given our dog was obviously not comfortable (enlarged spleen), stopped eating, and we wanted to do anything to help her for the last few months. A burst spleen is a painful way to go and taking them to a vet after it bursts, well they probably wouldn’t last the car ride. I said my goodbyes like it was maybe the last time I’d see her and we left her there that day and he had free time later and did the surgery same day. It went well for the spleen but he discovered numerous other small internal tumors that couldn’t be removed. He said after looking inside she maybe had a few weeks max. They were all over everything in her abdomen. We got her back a few days later and started trying to nurse her back to health. We planned to start chemo in about two weeks. Unfortunately she just couldn’t recover. She was weak prior to surgery and hadn’t been eating right for a while so she just didn’t have the strength to heal. Her belly started filling out the loose skin she had from the large spleen removal which was concerning. So we took her to our vet. She apparently started to have internal bleeding and fluid build up in her abdomen. They used a syringe to do a puncture and confirmed it. Our normal vet had some options but estimated it may just give her another week. We didn’t want to put her through any more pills or vet stays (she always hated vet visits) or further surgery’s. There was just too much cancer going on to ever successfully get rid of it. So we ended up putting her down at that appointment before things could get any worse. It was peaceful and she wasn’t going to suffer any more.

That’s the story. But since this is a review I do want to say MedVet was very helpful and upfront about everything. The risks were well explained and cost estimates were pretty much spot on with what they said and what we expected from any other place. Emergency dog care or surgery is going to be expensive. Not like some normal vet visit. People shouldn’t be surprised about that. And yeah it’s a business, so expect them to talk about payments. The price was a llittle bit higher than the bottom estimate because our dog stayed an extra day there and we had samples sent off to a lab, but it was still lower than the high side. It’s hard to be thankful to anyone when you lose a pet. And spending thousands on your dog only to have to put her down a week later is rough. I wish we didn’t do the surgery and put her through it but we didn’t know how bad things were. But I’m glad we had MedVet as an option and at least made an attempt to save her. I had no problems with the way they handled everything and I don’t blame them. We knew from multiple vets that things were bad and surgery was risky. But Dr Bufkin seems to be very good at what he does. I have a 24/7 vet significantly closer to me (5 min vs 45 min to MedVet). But the surgeon there was on vacation and no one else could see our dog. So again, I’m just glad MedVet was available and was able to get her surgery done so quick. I hope to never have to go again of course. But specifically MedVet itself, I had no issues with.

name: Stacy Adams
text: I cannot say enough good things about MedVet in Mobile, Alabama.  My dachshund just underwent IVDD surgery at the center and while he was there he received the highest level of care. But the attention didn't stop there. Dr. Bufkin and Tricia, the Vet Tech, were very patient and compassionate and explained, in detail, what was involved with the surgery... all while sitting with me on the floor while I held Bailey . Thank you Dr. Bufkin  Tricia, and the ENTIRE STAFF for taking such good care of Bailey!

text: Wonderful staff and very understanding when having to say goodbye to my old buddy.

name: Soli
text:
Very nice Clinic. Listened to everything I said. My dog couldn't use her back leg....they got her a rug to stand on so she didn't fall then they got her blanket to rest on. They reviewed the medical history thoroughly. Did a thorough exam on my dog. We previously had a surgery gone bad elsewhere and dr. Bufkin listened and treated my dog in all areas to help fix the bad surgery. We are now back to gaining weight, beginning to use her leg again, getting an infection under control, and getting her pain under control. I'm finally getting my "before surgery dog" back and I am thankful to them.
I should mention we drove 2hrs to this clinic bc there wasnt a board certified vet near my home. We wanted board certified bc a general practitioner botched initial surgery. Totally worth the drive.

name: Martine Steiger
text: They could not have been more caring and compassionate.

resp.text: Thank you Martine! We are glad that we were able to be there for you and your family when you needed us. We will be sure to pass your kind words along to our entire team!

name: Lyn, Mark, Zach Peters
text: We were staying in town from Illinois with our 13 year old Dax the Dachshund who at 1230am, decided to jump off the bed and hurt himself. We brought him in after being referred here by our front desk. The staff and Dr. Maertens took very good care of Dax and had us back on the road in no time at all. They did only what they felt was necessary and the cost was very affordable for emergency care. When traveling in the area in the future,  if needed will definitely revisit for care of our doggies. Thank you MedVet for taking good care of Dax, we all appreciated it!

name: Michelle Champagne
text: Thankfully they showed their greed over the phone, so we never darkened their doorstep! My senior dog who suffers from MCT had a nosebleed in the middle of the night. In a panic, I called these people seeking advice as I don't have a car and new it would be morning before I could get her there. The only advice they offered me was to "bring her in" and the $94 office visit was repeated several times. When I questioned them about other emergency vets available in the area...They drug their feet and finally told me that Rehm on Hillcrest was open and shortly added their vet was "only on call". I'd rather sit TWO DAYS waiting for an "on call" vet than I would to ever deal with these money grubbing people again! Fyi...We went to Rehm...The "on call" vet they spoke so poorly of...got there at the same time we did. AND...HE was AMAZING!!! My baby ended up staying for two nights with Rehm and they got her all fixed up! In an emergency situation you simply can't beat family owned and operated, supporting local economy, and top rate emergency care!!! :) Thank you Dr. Mike Rehm and Family we're telling EVERYBODY! ;)

resp.text: Thank you Michelle for taking the time to review our hospital. We are continually looking for feedback and we appreciate you letting us know that there are areas in which we can improve. We are very sorry that your experience with us did not meet your expectations, but we are glad that your dog is feeling better. Thank you again.

name: Melissa Burton
text: Friendly, but overpriced. They don't accept checks. Rather you pay cash. Will charge you extra if you use a debt card. Make sure you know what you are going to be charged before hand.

resp.text: Hi Melissa: Thank you for bringing your concerns about our hospital to our attention, and we appreciate your acknowledgment of our staff’s friendly client service. Our fees are based on our own costs to provide what we feel is exceptional care. Making sure your pet has the best and most current diagnostics, surgical equipment, and experienced staff ultimately pays off in the long run, because it results in fewer tests and procedures as well as healthier animals. Our policy regarding checks is one we arrived at after long experience and is not intended to be punitive or insulting, but one we had to adopt as a business because checks are no longer a reliable form of payment. We do pass along a small processing fee for credit and debit card use to avoid raising the cost of our veterinary services to cover them. As always, the health and well-being of your pets is our priority, and we hope to have the opportunity to provide care for them in the future. We would also welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns personally and invite you to contact us at the hospital at (205) 486-4500 if you wish to do so.

name: Demario Clarke
text: My experience was horrible I took my nine year pitbull in to be  spayed on a Wednesday evening and picked her up on Friday and noticed she was not acting herself. So I told the staff she wasn't acting right and they assured me that she should be ok and she was  just in recovery mode.  With that being said I call the Dr. On Monday and told him that she was  not still progressing the way I thought I she should have being, and again he assured me she should be ok and to bring her in if I seen any problems at the surgery site. Well here it goes I get home from work the next day which is Tuesday and she was bleeding and had herniated at the surgery site so i immediately took her back in. Dr beech immediately noticed that this was bad and she was rushed to the back for surgery. 3 hours later she was gone. Basically  3 days after i picked her up she died from a simple spayed. This has hurt my whole family in ways him any of his staff would ever know as I stated to him it seems like I give him 200 dollars to put him down.😓😓😓😓😓😓😓

name: Mary Hildreth
text:
Edited my review today, so this is new.  I dropped them down to two stars, and I would like to only give them one star but I'm upset right now so I won't do that.   We gave one dog away a couple years ago and mentioned it when we took the others in, and the new owner mentioned it too (a relative) and they still put it on our account.  That's ok, it's a mistake and everybody makes them, easy to fix.  I've been there twice I believe since then and both times I was told about the money owed for the dog I no longer have nor brought there for that service, and I told them that it's not my bill and made sure they had the contact info for the owner who brought him.  Again, that's not a problem . What is the problem though is when they won't neuter my two male cats for payment at the time of service until someone pays this bill, which they have been told over and over again, is not ours.  So yeah, give me my stars back.

They do good work and I do trust them and he will work with me on prices for multiple pets but it does me absolutely no good when I can't bring my pets in because someone else hasn't paid a bill that the vet's office has been told time and again is not mine .

It's not like I haven't told them and she hasn't . She has even told them and told them it's her bill.

Anybody want one of the kittens we will likely have in a few months since we can't get the males fixed right now?

name: Scott & Debra Henning
text: I took my 4 month old kitten Gracie to be spayed and get her vaccinations and boarded her for a week. They were supposed to call me after her procedure they didn't call so I called them to check on her they said she did well. On Friday when I called to tell them I was on my way to pick her up that's when the young lady told me that she had a couple raw spots on her face from rubbing her face on the cage needless to say when I got there and saw her I was very upset it looked very bad I asked if I needed to put medicine on it the vet told me no that they had put cream on it that it would be fine. She also had a bump the size of my knuckle in between her eyes. Well 3 days later it got progressively worse so I contacted them and I asked them what should I do she said bring her in for a checkup. I asked if there was a charge she said yes 50.00 I said I didn't feel that I should be charged since this happened to my baby on their watch so she said let me ask the vet she came back said no charge I then told her i didn't appreciate the way my kitten was treated that I was going to take her else where.  Her response was oh ok. Today I took Gracie to another vet and they said it's a bacterial infection and gave her antibiotics for a week then want to see her again in a week. I will post this to their FB page as well with a picture of my sweet Gracie

name: Griff Perry
text: Never thought I'd be leaving negative reviews on a business, but here I am. My wife and I had our 2 dogs boarded with Madison Animal Care Hospital over Memorial Day weekend. One thing that bothered me is that even though we were back in town on Monday they were closed so we couldn't pick them up. They still charged us for the day they were closed, but refused to let us pick them up. First red flag. When I picked them up Tuesday I noticed they had a green/yellow discharge coming from their eyes. I took them back to Madison Animal Care Hospital to get them looked at. Turns out they both had eye infections. Best part is they charged me full price for the examinations, tests, and medicine. No discount at all even though the most likely cause was from something they got into while being boarded by the same facility. Seems like this business is a little money hungry and they lack respect towards the people putting money in their pockets.

text: I received an estimate for service for $772 from them to treat a dog that was suspected to have pneumonia (we have another dog that was treat elsewhere a week prior with the same symptoms and the cost was less than $200). I was shocked by their pricing.

name: Eric Tran
text:
I had been taking my pets to this animal hospital for over 5 years. I've never had an issue with them, yet I don't know if the owners change or if it's just the staff.

I took my dog in to get an annual procedure. With the Covid19, everything is curbside now. The person came to the door and asked is this all we're doing or did I want to do blood work as well. I asked how much the blood work was and how much the full total was going to be. She estimated around $250. So I signed off and all was good. I had the vet come out and talk to me about my dogs health and it was all good. She told me someone would call me shortly so I could pay the bill over the phone. When they called, they said I owned $480.80. I asked her what happened to the $250 I was quoted? I completely understand an estimate is just that, an estimate. Yet when you're jumping over 100% over it's ridiculous. She told me someone would call me the next day to discuss.

I get a call from Christy who then tries to inform me that I was quoted $250 for the blood work only. She was very condescending and tried to pin this on me. Lucky for me, I keep a dash cam for insurance reasons and was able to send her the video of the whole conversation.

After they reviewed she calls me back and the first thing she says is "You win, we lose. $250 is the total." She proceeded to speak in a very condescending manner to me. This wasn't about winning or losing. She then tried to tell me that me recording on public property was illegal with a bit more rude attitude. I wonder how'd she feel to know I also record all my phone calls as well.

I say all this to state that I wouldn't go back her. I've been a loyal customer for over 5 years and have spent literally thousands on my animals. I guess $250 is worth more than a loyal customer.
